Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Kasparainens
Reviews.Content: Good tourist property. Of course, one needs to remember that room size in Madrid, similarly to Paris, is not the average american standard. And, of course, the hotel is not brand new, and could use some paint here and there. But the location is virtually few steps from metro and in walking distance to major sights, flamenco and tapas: what else one can wish being a tourist? The triangle-shaped micro elevator is most probably the tiniest in Europe. Decent breakfast. So, if you can get good price, recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Efficient Staff, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: IHateNoice
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel four nights in early August. The location is about as perfect as can be found if you want to be near the tourist things in the center of the city. The price is very good for a hotel in Madrid. The staff was reasonably friendly and very efficient. Long distance calls back to the States were very reasonable. I was traveling with a friend who stayed in another room and both rooms were very clean each day. There is a small store about three blocks up the Gran Via (in the direction of the Palace) which had a good selection of food and drink and reasonable prices. I have no real complaints about the hotel but the few things which would be improved are as follows. Granted both myself and my traveling companion are Americans, not thin but not huge and we had trouble fitting both into the elevator at the same time but I realize they have to fit the elevator where it can go without altering the walls of the building. The beds, while clean and adequete are not very comfortable, the rooms are extremely small maybe 16X8 feet, excluding the bothroom. The glass by the bed to control the water (keep it in the shower) does not work well but the tub is great. The walls are very thin. I could hear my friend in the next room coughing. There is an inroom safe which is very easy to use and much easier than having your money, etc locked up at the desk. Nothing really bad to say about this property and the good certainly outweighs my small complaints. I would not hesitate to stay there again. There is a metro stop about three minutes from the hotel. Starbucks (if you don't want a better place for coffee) is across the street and there is a McDonalds about two minutes away. Chuea, big party area, ecletic area is a very short walk from the hotel. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “I do not know what people are complaining about....”
Reviews.Author: Kiki T
Reviews.Content: We had a queen bed on the 7th floor (we had a small walk out balcony) Based on European hotels....this room was BIG. The washroom was huge, and we had more than enough room to get around our bed with luggage. People need to remember you are in Europe and not North America! Minibar was included in our price which was sweet because it was nice to have a late night drink or one before dinner. Breakfast buffet was included. Hardboiled eggs are overcooked...so we stuck to bacon sandwiches, fresh fruit, yogurt and coffee (who can dislike bacon!?!?) Location was great, everything was in walking distance. I went shopping along the Goja strip which was a few metro stops away (I chose to walk). I was very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal city centre location”
Reviews.Author: muddy1Hull
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights with my daughter. The hotel is perfectly situated on Gran Via and is very central. Several metro stations are within a few minutes walk giving great links to the rest of the city. The metro being very easy to use (and cheap). The room was reasonably large, very clean and tidy. Breakfasts were great wiith plenty to choose from catering to all tastes. Great value for money (paid about £53 per night). Loads of local bars/restaurants are within 5 to 10 minutes walk with a great variety as you would expect in any large city. Would definitely recommend this hotel as an ideal location for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, good breakfast, clean room”
Reviews.Author: SofiaGeorgia
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed at this hotel for two nights. The Hotel has fantastic location, two steps from famous Gran Via. close to Puerta del Sol, in the heart of Madrid. The room was of a normal size, very clean, the breakfast was very good, staff polite. They even let us to do check-out at 13:00 in stead of 12:00 p.m. The Touristic Bus starts its route just across the road at Gran Via street. You can walk from the hotel to the main touristic attractions in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, fantastic room”
Reviews.Author: Av111
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located in an abosolutely wonderful central location. Our room was on 7th floor and had a super large balcony, which I was not expecting that overlooked the Gran Via. Staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “clean and central”
Reviews.Author: AnnieBegg
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 2 nights in madrid and was very pleased. the rooms were clean and comfortable. breakfast was good and varied. This is such a central hotel - we were approx 5-10 min to Sol and about 30m walk away from the Gran Via metro station! the only thing is that the wifi was very intermittent and didn't seem to work sometimes (i am not shy with technology and can usually trouble shoot things but couldn't always get it to work) other than that I would recommend this hotel and would stay again if we were in Madrid again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: barbuhomme
Reviews.Content: What a great location!!! My partner and I visited Madrid for Gay Pride. The hotel is on Gran Via, just one block from the metro. The room was a bit small, but very comfortable. We had a large window that opened up onto Gran Via. We stayed in our room to watch the gay pride parade and we had a wonderful view. The A/C in the room works wonderfully, which is important after walking all over madrid. So many restaurants and shops were just outside the hotel. Breakfast was wonderful and the waiters were very friendly. There was some construction going on (a new front desk being built). But it was no bother to us. Only one elevator worked, the other had a notice that it was being replaced. So, we did have to wait for the evevator several times, but not a huge problem. Overall, we were very happy and would stay here again if we return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: optican
Reviews.Content: A very cozy and clean hotel in the city centre - very close to the main place in Madrid where you just need to talke a walk. The hotel has a bar that is perfect to enjoy a beer after walking around in Madrid. Also, they have one of the coolest small lifts I have ever seen!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Vacationtriptraveler
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect: right next to Gran Via and the shopping center of the city. It's in a part of the city where you can feel comfortable walking at night. There's always people passing by without it being too noisy. However, this is almost the only good criticism we have (that, and the porters, who were always there to greet us). The first room we booked had an overwhelming mothball smell and the second one smelled like sewers. Both of our rooms were on the sixth floor. The carpet in the hallways, although it seemed like it was vacuumed, is in really bad shape and needs to be shampooed. The room in itself was decent, just what you would expect from a Best Western room. Although advertised as a 4-star hotel, we would definitely not give it more than a 3.5. The rooms are old and need to be renovated before they can be considered a hotel we'd recommend. The bedheads were really old as well and were not in top shape (and looked a bit unclean). The bathroom in one of our 2 rooms had a bidet and the other one did not (not the problem) but instead had a huge mark on the floor where the bidet used to be. There were small holes in the floor and other holes were covered in sealant that looked like gum. The shower drain was awful and the tiles were cracked in some places. The room in itself was not in tip top shape. That being said, as previously mentioned, the location is great. The hotel is close to everything you need. We will probably not be staying there next time we're in Madrid but if you're only planning on using the room at night to sleep and do not mind not having a "spick-and-span" room, then you might want to consider this hotel, just for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing!!!”
Reviews.Author: markymillions
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night while passing through on a long road trip to portugal. Very relaxing and great breakfast. Well needed after driving for 10 hours straight!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorthernNJTraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights at the Hotel Arosa with our teen children and we could not be happier with our experience. The location was great, the rooms clean and modern and the staff very helpful. I have stayed in other parts of the city (for example in Cortes by the Prado and Retiro park). In my opinion the location of the Arosa right off the Gran Via is far superior. There are all kinds of things going on day and night and plenty of good places to eat. When I return to Madrid I will certainly stay at the Arosa. As an aside, I usually don't like to comment negatively on what others have written but unless you are an extrememly large person (or group of people) ignore those ridiculous comments about the elevators being small. We were on the 8th floor so the stairs were not an option and the elevators were just fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: vera d
Reviews.Content: spent three days and throughly enjoyed every minute. totally in centre of madrid but just on tip of side street of gran via avoiding most of the noise etc. lovely rooms, so clean and bright,breakfast was delicious, but top of the lot were the staff!!!! Juan AntoneSanchez at reception certainly makes a guest feel like royalty! enjoyed sitting in bar for cocktail before dinner and waitress Michaela just was so nice and efficient ! the minibar in the room was very handy for storing water etc., and the air conditioning was the best yet! recommend this hotel to anyone and will def go back! good deals to be got on internet!! undergoing some renovation which causes no problems, the recption is on 2nd floor, bit quirky but absolutely no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, clean, just OK AC”
Reviews.Author: Walter T
Reviews.Content: Good location. I booked here because of the gym, but the gym was only available after 10AM, which meant that I couldn't use it the day I checked out or before I started my day. The staff was friendly and helpful, but the AC didn't really work very well. Last summer, I stayed at Los Preciados, which cost a little more, but it was much nicer and cleaner, and the AC there was a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DebsConnolly
Reviews.Content: Hotel good value for money. Our room was a little noisy but to be expected given its location on the Gran Via. Beds very comfy and bathroom clean. Lovely reception area and breakfast area very good. Given what we paid I can't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Best air conditioning in Europe so far!”
Reviews.Author: kpb1nv
Reviews.Content: Good a/c is important to me. It is hard to find in Europe. In addition to the excellent location, very clean rooms, VERY comfortable beds for Europe and excellent value WITH a really nice buffet for breakfast --IT HAD EXCELLENT A/C. I would go back here a million times. This is our 12th? country to visit in Europe in last 3 years and this is the Best a/c we have had.........and we have stayed at many higher priced chains. Madrid can be hot. Stay here==excellent. There was a mixup with the Aero City shuttle they booked for us via email prior to us coming so just be sure to double verify it to avoid problems. That was the only problem that we had and thankfully the front door man jumped in and helped us. To be honest we came close to missing our flight. That part was not good. We did ask the night before and the am prior to the shuttle if they would reconfirm it at the front desk because they had booked it for us. We had not done it on our own but via them. They said no need and we wish we would have pushed harder but asking 2x is kinda pushing already. Front door man fixed it but still it arrived nearly 45 mins late and it was VERY busy at the airport so we were cutting it VERY close. Had we needed to check bags we would have missed our flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: No complaints here. Hotel good value for money especially for one which is so central. Clean room and good helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: pedluc
Reviews.Content: In my next time to Madrid I´ll try to find a better place. This place was ok but i felt i could had find a better price to stay paying the same. Very "cold" atmosphere .. it is a budget hotel .. you shoud not expect a lot of it ... but despite of that it is clean and very well located.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: kenamilanes
Reviews.Content: We discovered early in our trip that the cell phone purchased for European travellers did not work, so we were grateful to the hotel desk staff at The Hotel Mayorazgo for helping us contract our credit card company and for confirming bookings. The room we were shown and quoted a price on was far superior to the rooms were shown when we checked in, but we were told that the other rooms had been rented so we had to accept the best of what we got. However, though the rooms were disappointing, the breakfast buffet provided a delicious and plentiful variety of food, free with the room, and staff on every level were friendly and helpful. We particularly enjoyed the piano bar for relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Met our requirements”
Reviews.Author: IanChorleywood
Reviews.Content: As a couple on a 3-night break it was just what we needed. Central, good location & you can walk to all the sights. To get from airport to Via Gran Metro 4.5 Euros, not 2.5 as I've seen quoted. Room, bathroom, reception & restaurant smart & clean. Breakfast was good but beware pricing. We were quoted 8.5 Euro for the 3 nights & then were charged 14 Euros. Apparently the 8.5 is a special deal which you have to commit to when you sign in. The manager did, however, kindly back down & we paid 8.5. Comments about thin walls are true. We asked for room on 7th floor, not at the front & away from elevator & we got one overlooking the central area of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great.”
Reviews.Author: WillTravelForFood1
Reviews.Content: Would definitely recommend this hotel. We stayed there while in Spain for a wedding. The staff was great. We had a last minute addition to our party and they were very accommodating even though the hotel was full. The room was spacious, as was the bathroom. Clean and new. It was in a great location in Madrid city center. The only negative-it was very expensive one night due to a soccer game in the city. Overall great.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to experience Madrid”
Reviews.Author: oanatravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Arosa for 3 nights and I found that the staff tries hard to make everyone's stay a pleasant one. They are helpful, curteous and friendly. The rooms are typical european size (tight) but the bed was comfortable and the space was sufficient. Location is central, walking distance to all Madrid has to offer. Yes, the hookers set up camp around the corner, but it's a safe and touristy neighbourhood. I am a female and travelled alone...was hasseled by all the vendors/beggars more than others that were in a group, blame it on the economy. Breakfast in the hotel was great, even picked up a snack for later. It was not included in the room price, but probably worth the 7 euros/day.

Reviews.Title: “Even Better Than We Remembered”
Reviews.Author: BillT2
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Madrid and our second visit to this hotel... and it did not disappoint. It is located right on the Gran Via within easy walk of the Puerto del Sol and the Plaza Mayor. Bus lines (including the Tourista bus) right off the front door. We asked for a street view and our balcony overlooked the Gran Via. Sure you will get some street noise (we were on the 7th floor) but that is to be expected in a big city. If we had wanted silence we would have stayed in the country. One of its two elevators is a small triangle fit for two people and adorable. We found the front desk personnel not only helpful but even suggestive of several activities, restaurants, etc. No complaints whatsoever and hopefully we will be back to the Arosa again.

Reviews.Title: “The best is the location!”
Reviews.Author: yarelicar
Reviews.Content: This is a great option to stay in Madrid for business or tourism. The Hotel is basic but very good. I have stayed 2 times in my visits to madrid, and the best of all is the location. Right in the Gran Via and next to the metro station. I have not tried the restaurants. They have free internet for the guests and a internet corner in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Strange hotel”
Reviews.Author: BogdanDumitru74
Reviews.Content: strong points: very central, very close to 3 subway stations, good breakfast minus: to much noise, strange reception, small room, unusefull elevators

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: tinneas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days and were really pleased with our selection. The entrance to the hotel is in a side street but don't let that put you off. We had a nice airy room with 2 large windows looking out on the Gran Via. I have read reports about the noise from the traffic but it did not effect us. There was a good buffet breakfast with a choice of hot or cold meal, juices, fruit, yogurt etc. for anyone interested in going on a trip on the hop on off bus to historic Madrid the bus stop was just across the road. To go on the trip of Modern Madrid it is just a short walk away. There is also a tourist office less than a 5 minute walk away. The buildings in Madrid are awesome, very old and one nicer than the other. In fact I think I prefer it to Paris. There are numerous restaurants around the place with great choices. We would definitely return to this hotel again, it was great value and the location was perfect. There are of course numerous restaurants everywhere you go.

Reviews.Title: “Wins on location but because of the location it's noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Duck_UK
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel overlooking Gran Via, which means it's noisy all the time. Staff are helpful; lifts (especially the left one, in the size of small triangle) are small. Wifi is free but not particularly quick. Our bathroom was split - toilet on one side of the room and main, but small, bathroom on the other side. Avocado was fashionable once, but not now. Breakfast was good, bed was small for a double.

Reviews.Title: “Central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: merseytripper
Reviews.Content: This is a very central hotel, in a side street off the Gran Via which is the main shopping street. There is a good buffet breakfast, which caters for all tastes, in hot items. Between 6pm and 8pm, you can get a free glass of cava in the bar area. There are also 2 computers with free internet access and the hotel has free wifi which can be accessed in your room. There is easy access from the airport on the metro and the Gran Via metro station is 5 minutes walk away. At the time of our visit in April 2012, the metro ticket was 2.5 euros each way. There a numerous restaurants and bars in the area and the Puerto del Sol is only 5 minutes away. We highly recommend this hotel and found it excellent value for money. The staff were very helpful and speak English.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but there are better places near”
Reviews.Author: mhernan
Reviews.Content: such a very good location just meters of lively Gran Via avenue. Lift was the weirdest and uncomfortable thing about this hotel, you gotta use stairs cause there is always using it! Could be such a mess for someone with children or minusvalid ones. Good points: Clean bathroom, silence is good, comfy bed, nice amenities, location, helpful and nice staff. Bad points: horrible view from window, no breakfast included (and the restaurant is not cheap, avoid it if you can), wifi free but slow, lift TOO small (both, the very small and the even smallest one), awful PAID TV service and radio (come on! you are Best Western hotel chain, you can do it better)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and value for money”
Reviews.Author: billieteacup
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for 5 days in February. Rooms are a little dated in decor but very clean. Small lift mentioned in previous reviews is very unique but there is another lift too. Staff were very friendly and helpful (pilar is wonderful) .Location is great, central to all shops, museums, restaurants etc. great value for money and I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Colin S
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comfortable and the staff welcoming and friendly. Located centrally, it is within easy reach of many of the major visitor attractions, with plenty of restaurants and bars close by too. Our room was not huge, but equipped with everything we needed or expected, including a balcony and free use of the minibar which was restocked every day (not sure what we did to get that, but very welcome!). Despite being in the city centre, it was quieter at night than I anticipated, resulting in a good night's sleep. They do advertise an airport shuttle, but on arrival at the airport we were quoted a 40 minute wait, and the return journey was at a fixed time every hour, which didn't match our flight times, so we decided for the relatively small additional cost to use a taxi (c. 35-40 Euros each way). The minute lift is a talking point.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: Mary B
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights and were very pleased with the staff and accommodations. The location can't be beat as you are steps away from two Metros 1) Sol and 2) Gran Via. The room was sizable and comfortable; however, it tended to be a tad warm as the air conditioning was not used. We opened the window which opened to the interior, but the ground level noise was a bit much one night. You must experience the smallest elevator in the world. We never waited too long for either the small or larger elevator from our 5th floor room. I wouldn't rate this property a 4 star hotel, but overall it is a good value and you can't be the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Ocean11
Reviews.Content: Great location. One working elevator. Rooms are dated but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Maxibird
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at this hotel in central Madrid. The location on the Gran Via is ideal, close to a metro station, shops and within walking distance of the many sights of this beautifull city. Our room was quite modern and spacious but did not have a street view. I thought the bed was very comfortable. The staff were pleasant and the breakfast was good - more than continental but not quite a buffet. One of the lifts is unique - it's narrow, sort of a triangle shape and only accomodates 2 people! I would recommend this hotel for anyone wishing to stay in central Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but definitely not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: CF2_12
Reviews.Content: I just spent 5 nights at the Hotel Arosa. The hotel is very convenientely located, about 50 mts from the metro station (gran via) and a short walk from Plaza del Sol and Plaza mayor, but the room is quite old and too small and I was in a room without a street view and also the AC was not working. There were a noise in the up floor everynight, whole night. There was a free wi-fi internet access which reasonable connection speed. Shuttle service to the airport available at the hotel is very convenient. I´ve paid only EUR12,00, and they come to pick us up in the hotel at the scheduled time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scousegirl67
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the Hotel Arosa. Hotel is very conveniently located and perfectly adequate for a short stay. I requested a smoking room which, Ive got to say was quite basic but my friends stayed in a non-smoking room which had been refurbished and was far nicer. Ours was a room only package so cant comment on the standard of breakfast but we started each evening with a few drinks in the hotel lounge. This was an extremely comfortable room and the staff working the bar were extremely friendly and made us feel very welcome. I agree with other reviewers in that to class this as a 4 star Hotel would be stretching the imagination somewhat (!) but the cost was very reasonable compared to some other Madrid hotels and I feel that we got good value for money. I would therefore recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a clean, friendly and central base for their stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location,friendly atmosphere but not a 4star hotel”
Reviews.Author: AngeRo_84
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in this hotel, the location is just perfect, right on the Gran Via, this long and colorfull street full of shops and cervezeria, very near to all the best sights and museum of the city. The rooms in the corner have a great view on the street and doesn't has too noise. The staff is friendly, specially the one at the breakfast. At our arrival we remained surprised from the elevator....so little and irregular!!! Even the rooms surprise us, usually the Best Western have a good design and hight standards in cleanness but this one was a bit different: the rooms where not too big and clean but we appreciate the kindness of the staff who tried to find us another room. Apart from this points we spent a good time, Madrid is a great city, full of life and things to see.

Reviews.Title: “Good location,very nice rooms,not a 4 star but I liked it a lot!!”
Reviews.Author: victoriafromgreece
Reviews.Content: I spent one day in Madrid and had reserved a single room at Arosa with Olotels, which costed much fewer than in other sites!!arriving at the hotel they upgraded by giving me a double room on the Gran Via which didn't bother me at all, Ii did't hear terrible noices during the night, just some avenue rumour. the room was well decorated, clean a little old, the bathroom clean but old too. what I liked more was the breakfast which had everythong for all tastes, sweet/salt , spanish/american buffet.I really liked it!!! i would not consider it a 4 star hotels,but a 3 star superior!!! overall Ii am satisfied by the room and the personnel which is always smiling and helpful...

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Location”
Reviews.Author: Love_to_travel147
Reviews.Content: Just spent a few days at this hotel. It's location is just about perfect as it is on the Grand Via about 150 mtrs from the Grand Via metro station. Nearly all the sights and museums are within walking distance and there are plenty of restaurants in the vicinity. The staff at the hotel are courteous and willing to help if possible. Our only complaint was being allocated a smoking room when we had asked for non-smoking, although after leaving the window open for a while the odour soon disappeared. We enjoyed our short stay and would definitely use it again if we return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LSCSurrey
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from four nights in this hotel. Although it is undergoing redecoration on the outside, so isn't looking its best, it is ideally situated and within easy reach of all the galleries and other attractions. Our room was quiet and comfortable, with loads of hot water for baths and showers. Not much of a view from the window, but who cares about that when you're just sleeping there? Attentive service without being OTT. Great breakfasts and lovely bar/lounge area, with special offers each night (free cava or two for one cocktails). Excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Second time to this hotel - best location in town!”
Reviews.Author: HaifaMiu
Reviews.Content: First time I stayed in this hotel in 2010 for a business and now came back for 4 days in Madrid with my wife. Very advised Executive package with good and large room facing Gran Via, free minibar (limited choice but sill nice) and breakfast. I think one of the best values for this money in heart of Madrid. The hotel itself is OK, not fantastic. Breakfast is basic, but was tasty and good enough. As usual enjoyed the smallest lifts ever seen. Staff is very helpful, and we thankful for that. Currently hotel is under restoration outside and the view is limited. the building is covered from outside. To conclude: I cannot say about standard rooms, but for us it is a great choice and we will come again on next stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel, could be better”
Reviews.Author: Redjim1892
Reviews.Content: The good. Friendly staff, great location, cleanliness, frew wifi, breakfast. The unique lift. The bad. Small rooms. The worman drilling at 8 in morning outside your window. The room facilities aren't as described online - there is no tea/ coffee making facilities, ironing board etc. Overall it is a an ok hotel, but 3 star not 4.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel very central in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Jalbda
Reviews.Content: Good hotel very central in Madrid. At the Gran Via and in the direct vicinity to Sol.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Bav20
Reviews.Content: Yes, the elevator was small, but I found it more comical than intrusive. I've seen it hold a max of 4 people, but go up alone when you're bringing luggage. Location was perfect for my needs, it is located on a small side street of the main street of Gran Via, which has lots of chain brand stores and some restaurants. If you walk down the side street, there are great smaller shops and smaller bars. I was able to walk to all the places I wanted to go, indoor market San Miguel, Sol plaza, shopping, eating, all within 15 mins walk. A bit further, but possible, are the museums Reina Sofia and Prado, etc. probably took me about 30 mins to walk. There was scaffolding in front of the hotel when I was there, didn't bother me, as I didn't want a room facing the street anyways (I was initially placed in a room which did, but it is true, you can hear everything from the street and would get very loud at night). The new room I was assigned to faced away from the street and was very quiet. My single room was small but had everything I wanted, a comfortable bed, a free safe (some places make you pay 1 Euro each time you use it) free wifi in the room (confirm for yourselves if it is free, as I may have gotten a deal with it included) and a fridge and heat/ac control. Traveling solo, I felt very safe walking around by myself and to and from the hotel. Now, the only bad thing I have to say about the hotel is this: every time I came into the room from a days outing I could smell a bad odour from the bathroom, possibly coming from the other rooms' bathrooms via a vent, or possibly the sewage system via the toilet. It wasn't overpowering, but still a smell nonetheless. As my purpose of travel was to enjoy and explore Madrid and the rest of Spain and spend only my sleeping hours at the hotel, this is not enough for me to not recommend the hotel, as I would stay there again. I bought a room spray at the Yves Rocher next door and it solved the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average - good stay - but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Megan96
Reviews.Content: Stayed in October for a 3 night city break. Madrid is a fantastic city and the Arosa is well situated to enjoy the sights and to visit some of the great food establishments nearby. The hotel is currently undergoing sandblasting of the exterior so is covered in scaffolding and the balconies (in rooms with balconies) are 'unusable' as a result. Ordered fruit and Cava in the room prior to arrival which was correctly arranged and was a fantastic collection of fruit that lasted for the stay!! There was some noise from other rooms as the soundproffing is not fantastic but the higher floors did not seem to suffer greatly from city noise although it was present - possibly more noticeable on lower floors. Room perfectly adequate, air conditioning satisfactory, good bath room. Staff were OK although had little interaction. Breakfast OK - can be busy in a small area of the lobby / lounge. Wi-Fi was free but connection / speed was patchy. We would not have used the Gym but were unaware there was one as it does not seem to be promoted / mentioned. The much commented lift has to be the smallest (and triangular) cabin ever - max 2 people, no luggage and cosy!!) Starbucks opposite hotel was great whilst waiting for the tourist bus or just for the twice daily fix!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location....noisy elevator”
Reviews.Author: chrisk828
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights between Christmas and New Years. The location is great and walking distance to all the sights we wanted to see, plus getting there from the airport on the subway was easy. I had read other reviews about a noisy elevator and the first night we were put in the room with the noise. I could literally hear the elevator going up and down and I woke up several times when the elevator banged to a stop or when noisy people came out of the elevator late at night. We asked for a change of room and the staff changed us to a better room without any problem or hassle. The second room was much better, from decor to a bigger bathroom and more space. Overall we thought the staff was helpful and we appreciated being changed to a better room.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Naomi75
Reviews.Content: The Pro's - The location is within walking distance to the Parque del Buen Retiro, the Palace, and the Plaza Mayor. It is also just around the corner from Puerta del Sol which is a very lively hub of activity after dark (though you should probably be careful about going out on your own too late here as there are some unsavoury characters). Free minibar (but then hotel is expensive, so it all balances out). The Con's - We picked this hotel as it was a Best Western and we stayed in a number of their hotels on this trip, all of them lovely, except for this one.This is not a 4star hotel - perhaps a 3 (at most). Breakfast was terrible - sloppy scrambled eggs,chewy tough bacon which appeared to be 2days old and extremely sour milk in the coffee machine. Parking is actually offsite in a public parking station which is dark, dingy, and quite frankly, scary - not to mention, expensive, at 27.50euro overnight. The lift, which claims to be uniquie (it's triangular shaped), is actually small and completely useless (can only fit 1 person, no luggage). Rooms are dark, dingy, old, not very clean, and most definitely not soundproofed. Worst of all, however, was the fact that reception staff charged the credit card we used to secure our booking though booking.com, before we had even checked out and without gaining our authorisation. The biggest problem with this being that we had advised at checkin that we had an international prepaid travel mastercard and would be using that to settle our bill. Instead, we had to pay not only the totally unjustified room rate, but a quite hefty international transaction fee as well. Very rude and presumptuous. We will definitely not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: sneilkSpain
Reviews.Content: This hotel was rated as 4 stars. This wouldn't be true in anyone's wildest imagination. How many four star hotels dispense soap and shampoo from a squeeze bottle hung on a wall? It was harsh soap that's supposed to double as body wash and shampoo. NO amenities at all would be the best way to describe what is provided. I had to go look for a bar of soap. The bathroom had only a small sink area with no room to put anything so all personal items got drenched every time you turned the water on. The carpets in the common areas are soiled and worn. The furniture in the rooms was worn and the pillow hard as rocks. There was no coffee pot or pot to boil water for tea...like I said, NO amenities at all...BUT.. The worst feature of this hotel was the dusty dirty construction scaffolding outside the windows with with workers either looking in or making lots of construction noise beginning in the morning and continuing all day. You could open the terrace door but immediately wish you hadn't. The staff was nice enough, but this is a two star hotel in every way, and that's being generous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!!”
Reviews.Author: sixthgearmusic
Reviews.Content: We started our trip in Madrid with lost luggage, thanks to the airline. The hotel staff were very helpful in tracking our luggage down. Another bonus was the free internet and although there is only 2 computers it was never more than 5 minute wait. The room was a little small, but great value for the price. Bathroom needed a little TLC. There was no view out the window b/c there was another building right next door. The elevators are extremely small. Great location in Centro.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bocadilla
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in June 2011 - great hotel and location. Staff very friendly. Madrid is a fantastic city full of great people:) Nice to experience culture instead of some tacky beach resort The metro system is cheap and easy to use, lots to do and see and the food and drink is amazing

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean room, hilarious elevator”
Reviews.Author: K S
Reviews.Content: A number of commenters have complained about the smaller elevator, but I have to tell you, we laughed about that thing every time we used it for two days. Not just the size, but sometimes it takes you to floors you never even dreamed of visiting (or signaled for.) It was an adventure. Our room was well-sized and very clean, the largest of our rooms in Spain. The scaffolding was annoying, yes, and the workmen smashing around on it at 8am not awesome but that will be gone soon I imagine. I will note that the pictures on the site may be several years old now, it appeared to me to be a bit more "broken-in" than I expected. The lounge, however, was very nice and we found the service there to be excellent, even with a small language barrier (the only phrase my mother learned in Spanish was "vino blanco, so she did okay.) After a day of sightseeing we enjoyed sitting for a bit having a glass of wine and some light snacks in the evening before heading out for dinner. Toilet closet separate from the shower / sink room is convenient for two travelers in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “great location but bad impresion about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: zagos
Reviews.Content: we staied at this hotel for 3 nights as a couple. the location of the hotel is perfect, few steps away from Grand Via and all the main attactions. the hotel was small and old, with small rooms with old furniture, only the bathroom was ok. most of the staff is not speaking english and for this they are not very helpfull! for our next trip we will choose another hotel but in the same area! as city madrid is nice, but you should take the train (30 minutes ride) to Toledo and spend at least one day there!

Reviews.Title: “greatt location, and nice Help”
Reviews.Author: reelfine22
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 6 nites in Nov . Room was very generic but bathroom was exceptional for europe (Large). The lacation was super 5 min walk to Puerto del sol ,!0 min to Plaza Mayor . Gran Via metro was 2 min walk from hotel . The help was very nice esp Isabella at front desk Very nice Just watch out for the smaller of two elevators Would go back in a heart beat

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mable13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Arosa for a week in October 2011 and it met nearly all of our needs. The best thing about the hotel is its ideal location. With its central location, the main tourist attractions are easily accessible and within walking distance. Much of our room was updated, but it still had an old CRT television with two channels in English (BBC World News and CNBC). The front desk was helpful and generally everyone that helped us there spoke English. The front desk was kind enough to call the agency we booked a tour with one morning and arrange for us to reschedule because we both came down with food poisoning. Our primary complaint with the hotel was the spotty internet connection in our room (729). We could rarely connect in the room and had to go to the hallway or the lobby to connect so we could use the internet. We spent a lot of evenings in the Puerta del Sol area, which is close to the hotel and full of great tapas bars (check out El Escarpin and Tapas y Canas) and shops. It is easy to get to the hotel from Barajas airport using the metro, but be prepared to lug your suitcases up and down numerous sets of stairs and escalators--this is a particular chore if you have a large suitcase or multiple bags. Since we missed the sign up time for the shuttle back to the airport (7:00pm the previous evening), we took a cab to the airport. Although it cost $40, we felt it was worth not having to drag our bags back through the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: Compo1
Reviews.Content: Originally booked a superior room and we were allocated a poor room that had a lovely view of some scaffolding! This was my wife and my first visit back to Madrid in 13 years and I expected more from the Arosa. After explaining our disappointment to the front desk they offered a smaller but nicer room but still not the room we were promised. We decided to change hotel - went to the Atlantico which turned out to be cheaper and is fantastic! Lovely rooms and hotel. Don't book the Arosa the Atlantico is so much nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay overnight”
Reviews.Author: anabelPerth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good value. It is clean & has everthing you need, breakfast was included for us. And it is close to the Barajas airport - what we needed. It is a little small & the elevator is really small. My husband & I had to take turns going up to our room because only one person & a suitacase fitted in the elevator at one time & we are not big people. But, I can't say anything bad about the hotel because the location is great. When you step outside you will see some fantastic restaurants/cafes - great service & food (really nice food). And there are many shops that you might find useful & an atm down the road - sometimes atm's are hard to find - we found this the hard way. We stayed at a more expensive hotel in Madrid (The Hilton), also near the airport but it was about 4 times the cost but offered only a little more luxury - you only need comfort & cleanliness for one night's stay. We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel - friendly staff, hotel shuttle service & a buzzing street at our doorstep. Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: PopsEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in October 2011 - hotel centrally located for everything we wanted to visit and near a metro station to get further afield. Room was comfortable and clean, although as the room was on the Gran Via main road did suffer from traffic noise. Staff were always helpful, breakfast very good, confortable lounge with internet access. Just what we wanted for a short city break

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the center of everything.”
Reviews.Author: jaydub1948
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Arosa for six nights in October 2011. The room was nice and clean as was the bath. The bed was comfortable as well. We loved the breakfast buffet which had fresh orange juice to drink as well as a fantastic push button coffee machine with cafe con leche, cappuccino and cafe solo as well as decaf cafe con leche and cafe solo. There were several kinds of ham, rolls, bocadillos, tortilla española, as well as the most delicious scrambled eggs. There was also yogurt, granola, and probably some other things I didn't try. It is in a great location as we walked everywhere. The staff was helpful as well. I definitely plan to stay there again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “The bathroom is dirty”
Reviews.Author: MariaCarolinaA
Reviews.Content: There was a lot of hair on the bathroom's floor, and there is no refreshing air, smells like mold. The staff is not nice, and we got a non smoking floor, but the whole place smells like cigarettes.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe at Half the Price”
Reviews.Author: SavySally
Reviews.Content: Its like a bare bones budget hotel but at a fine hotel price. A fridge with a small tv perched on top. Lights nailed to the wall . No toiletries. Hookers line a near by block. So disappointed to end our vacation there.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: hippychickUk
Reviews.Content: I went with 3 friends for a short city break in July 11. It was VERY hot in Madrid (35-40c) but the rooms had great A/C so that wasn't a problem. There was nothing super fancy here and it was a little rough around the edges but it was the most affordable we could find for the location. Breakfast included and great. In the heart of the action.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: fair-the-best
Reviews.Content: great hotel no parking small room small lift at all it is great

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a Best Western”
Reviews.Author: reyledda
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many Best Western Hotels all over the world, but was not sure what to expect for one in Madrid. The location is great, very close to a metro stop, and right on Gran Via, a main shopping artery. We only stayed for one night as this was our first pit stop before heading off to Sevilla. We arrived very early in the morning but the hotel was able to get us a room right away. Unfortunately they gave us 2 twin beds instead of one double - always a hindrance with a male couple traveling together. We were on a higher floor that had a charming view of Madrid rooftops. (Warning: One of the elevators is wedge-shaped and is so small, 2 people with their luggage will be a tight fit - so be prepared to wait. If you can walk down, just do it!) There is a small Juliet balcony but it's the side of the hotel that had scaffolding so it was pretty useless. Being on Grand Via also had its drawback as there was a protest outside an office building across the hotel - you could hear the bullhorns even with your windows closed. Bonus - there is a Starbucks across the street if you just can't live without your chai latte. Overall just an ok hotel. There are probably better options for a longer stay - but for one night, it was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: tradertpc
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Europe and Hotel Arosa was our first hotel of the trip. We really started off on the right foot! This place is in such a great location on Madrid's Gran Via. We arrived weary from our 7 hour flight. We got to the hotel at about 10am. They checked us right in and we were so happy. Took a nap and hit the town. So close to all the sights, and the Gran Via metro station was right there! The room was clean and had big windows to look out over the city. The price was right and I highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but why the scaffolding?”
Reviews.Author: Dedalus54
Reviews.Content: My room was small but clean and adequate as I was out and about most of the time. The scaffolding was a nuisance as it obscured the view from my window and, like a previous reviewer, I never saw any work being done. So why is it there? The safe in the room was a bit of a trial - I had to enter the code quite a few times before it would either lock or unlock. A special mention has to be given to the very friendly barman.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay !”
Reviews.Author: pcfixer077
Reviews.Content: Have booked a 3 night one single room for my trip to Madrid through Flight center in Melbourne and looking back was a great decision. The stuff was polite,you can print your online ckecked-in ticket at the computer in the lobby,great buffet breakfast. The room was a good size for a single room with a bathroom,shower/tube and overall very clean.Is a non-smoking hotel. The facade of the hotel is in renovation having the scafolds all around but that never interfeered with my holiday as I was most of the day out sightseeing.I was once at the hotel at 2 pm on a friday and was no sign of work done to the hotel. Located on Gran Via corner with Salud it means is in the heart of Madrid with everything to be visited in walking distances. The price is a good value when I comapred with the service I got in a similar 4 star hotel in ,London or Rome and I personal would stay here again next time. Enjoy Madrid is a great place to visit ...you must see the Royal Palace and El Estorial Monastery(a 4 hour trip with an tourist agency) or 1 hour drive out of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: lon488
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Arosa hotel for 4 nights. I arrived late and asked for a smoking room, they did not have one available. I was given room on the 7th floor which is non smoking floor. My room 729 overlooking Gran Via and had a balcony which is better then smoking in the room. Perfect! My bed was the best bed in hotels ever in Spain! Normally they are too hard, but not in Arosa! Breakfast was good, staff friendly, hotel very clean. No hair shampoo supplied so bring your own one.Both lifts small, but fast and fun if you not suffering from claustrophobia. Mardid is great in summer, very busy but exciting!! People are very friendly and helpful. I was on my own and meet very nice local people and tourists. Please visit Cocolateria San Gines, great place! Have a dinner at Plaza Major (not for food but for atmosphere). Great food in Restaurant Kitchen Stories, just off Plaza Major, tuna dish was fab!!! Don't forget to book the airport transport from to hotel! Only 12 euros, very fast and comfortable..

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: SPtraveller_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Madrid for three nights from the 16-19th July and this hotel was convenient for our needs. We were only ever in our room to sleep and the beds were comfortable, the room size reasonable and the bathroom facilities were good and clean. (A review below mentioned that the bathrooms were quite small, my room was on the seventh floor and the bathroom was what I would consider to be a good size). The air conditioning worked really well, the room was always a nice cool temperature which was great as it was so hot out. The hotel it self is in a good location, we used the metro to get to and from the airport. Otherwise we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go (to the Royal Palace, Prado Muesum and other art galleries in the same area). Should we have wanted to use the metro more often the Gran Via metro station was just a couple of minutes walk away. We had a slight issue when we first got to the hotel. We checked in and were given a room on the fifth floor, I opened the door to find people's luggage in there- there was obviously still someone occupying the room. I went straight down to reception and they were apologetic and gave us another room straight away. We sat at the bar for a drink every evening. Although I didn't catch her name (my Spanish is not very good) the lady behind the bar every evening was lovely and always inviting. I think she deserves a mention! Breakfast was reasonable. I'm a vegetarian and there was plenty of food available for a vegetarian. There were pastries, breads, fruit, yogurts, cereals eggs and cheese. All in all the stay was extremely pleasant. If you're looking for a hotel close to all the sights, a reasonable price and don't expect anything too fancy this hotel will be great for you. If I was traveling on a budget and was ever to return to Madrid again, I would definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would return!”
Reviews.Author: SarahJG19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and would definitely recommend. The room was clean and comfortable and the hotel is conveniently located on Gran Via and right next to the Metro. Good value for money also. One thing that you can't go past is the elevator - it is the smallest we have ever seen and it is a mission to try and fit to adults with luggage! Tips - shops, restaurants and cafes don't really open till 10am - so if you plan to venture our earlier make sure you are aware of this!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: djjaguar
Reviews.Content: Hotel: Location is excellent for first time guests. We had booked the executive package and were quite happy with the Japanese themed room(bed is low). No issues at all with staff. We had breakfast but were disappointed that on our last day we missed it since breakfast only starts at 7am unlike other hotels where it starts at 6am. We also tried the hotels gym and it was adequate. Internet in room did not work very well, and we resorted to using the pc's in the breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel near city center”
Reviews.Author: unicron1
Reviews.Content: the smallest pair of elevators i have ever been in. One fits about people in the other three. My companion and i had a room( 6th floor) near the alley , i always heard a person taking out the trash at around 3am , other than that it was quite.

Reviews.Title: “New city tour MADRID”
Reviews.Author: heinjan
Reviews.Content: After many city tours throughout Europe as well as Spain (lately Barcelona and Valencia) we choose Madrid and an hotel right in the center with walking distance to all high-lights. Arosa is a very best choice. We booked in advence for a week at a moderate price. The entrance and the reception on the 2nd floor seemed quite odd. Scaffolding all around the building, but people were taking it down. We changed rooms from the 5th floor to the japonese floor, without scaffolding. Reception was very friendly and helpfull. We ended up in a spacious room, all funrnished in japonese way, so the beds were okay, but close to the floor. Bamboo type of vinyl flooring, excellent bathroom. The breakfast which was included in the price was ok, however the hotel was very busy (gay parade) so you had to wait refilling eg scrambling eggs. The lounge and bar were cosy, free drink and cocktails ok., service very good. Wifi on the room works excellent, no problems printing our e-tickets in the lounge. A point of criticism is the location of the reception and the 1 1/2 elevator for a think 160 rooms. As architect I know something about capacity calculations on elevators. I never have seen this nor designed this my live. Looking to the emergency plan I saw two extra lifts in the other emergency stairwell. I am curious how the future wil look like in Arosa.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable with some shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: Moniqa
Reviews.Content: Location: this is the best part of this hotel. The entrance to the hotel is on a side street to Gran Via, the most famous street in town with lots of stores, coffee shops and restaurants. You can walk from here to most of the sights and there are several metro and bus stations nearby. Unfortunately in the pedestrian area to the right of the Gran Via metro station there seems to be the red light district. Room: we booked the executive room and I think we probably got the best room in the hotel: on the 8th floor overlooking the Gran Via. The room is pretty small (I expected it to be bigger for an executive!) with ugly PVC flooring but on the plus side the bathroom is very nice with complementary liquid soap and shower & hair gel. The room is overall nicely furnished but the bed is too low and the matrace is only placed on top of it in the middle so there's a big gap betweet the matrace and the wall, which might look fashionable but it's uncomfortable. The view of the room is on Gran Via but they're restoring the building front so there's scaffold right in front of the windows which ruins the view. For our entire stay I have not seen any workers doing any cleaning and painting on the building front. Breakfast: the usual bread rolls, toast, boiled eggs, hams, sausages, bacon, cheese, pastry, croissant, muffin, three types of cereals, fresh fruits but microwaved scrambled eggs and no salads. Ice cubes for the juices was a nice touch. There's also miso soup with rice which I found unusual. Free wireless internet: username and password is provided by the reception free of charge upon request. Even though connected to the network with 2-3 lines, the internet doesn't work most of the time. I constantly have to try to re-connect until it starts working but even then it works only for a few minutes. Lobby: very nice with a bar, comfy couches and two computers connected to the internet (username and password from the reception). I checked in for our return flight on one of them and printed the tickets directly to the printer at the reception at no extra cost. Staff: they get the job done but it wouldn't hurt if they would be friendlier and most importantly if they would smile a bit. What I found incredibly disturbing is the cleaning lady cleaning up in the rooms next to us at 8 in the morning! The walls are thin so I could hear her bump into things, speaking loud and vacuum clean like she was right next to me. Of course on a more normal time for cleaning up when the guests are in the city, like at 12 at noon, her cleaning stuff was on the hallway but she was nowhere to be found. Gym: there's a gym on the 8th floor but we didn't try it. All in all, I think this is more like a 3* hotel and, if you want good location and you can accept these limitations which I described above (like we did), you'll have a nice stay. P.S: The tiny elevator is hilarious!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient downtown location!”
Reviews.Author: Tamuda
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 night at Best Western Arosa, and I wasn't very impressed with the overall quality of this over-starred (4*) hotel. I would give it no more that 3 and half stars. The hotel is centrally located just a few feet away from the metro station Gran Via, and also a couple of minutes walk to the famous Plaza del Sol. The smallest elevator I've seen so far was in this hotel, and I don't think an overweight person would fit in it. Unlike other hotels in Spain, you need to use your credit card to lock and unlock the in-room safety deposit box, which basically defeats the main purpose of storing the valuable items (including the credit card) in the box. The breakfast is overpriced (€14) and it's not worth the money. There are so many cafes around the hotel, where you can have breakfast for a lot cheaper. On a different note, there is a nice restaurant with friendly waitresses just a few steps down the street from the hotel that serves very delicious Galician food, and you won't regret eating there either lunch or dinner. To not get confused with other restaurants nearby, this Galician restaurant has a large glass door entrance and the table chairs are in white/green color.

Reviews.Title: “what a beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: milou27
Reviews.Content: Center town is just close by, you can get metro easily, everything what you like to visit is reachable by foot, yes the best way to see town anyhow ! People at reception are quite nice and helpful, we did not have breakfast included in arrangement but could get it at hotel without problem, there was a special offer when we went. Breakfast is good : orange juice, coffee or tea or milk, bread, toast, ham, marmelades, honey, butter, eggs, chease, sweets and fruits. Maybe it could be different sweets every day, but of course you can choose everytime something else, one day salty, one day sweet, and one day cereals. Outside the hotel there are many places where you can get some sweets and full breakfast too. Rooms on last floor, japanese floor, are just beautiful. Room big enough, bathroom too, everything is very clean. Sure a nice place !

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: LondonDonald
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via Expedia and got a really cheap rate by paying in advance, non-refundable. On arrival I got upgraded to King room which was great. This hotel has been upgraded and decorated fairly recently and is above average for Best Western, 1 min from subway. Location could not be better, right in the middle of shopping area and night life. One of the hotel lifts is a small triangle and the hotel believes it may be the oddest shaped lift in the world. Free wifi throughout the hotel, though not very reliable, it's free. Reception staff a bit grumpy and never smile, but the room maids do. The buffet breakfast is a little pricey but plenty Starbucks etc nearby if you want to save money. But definitely I'll stay at this hotel again, attractive, clean, great location and unbeatable value for money

Reviews.Title: “Stuck in the 1970s”
Reviews.Author: Patchpup
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights and expecting a 4* hotel as advertised on the booking site. Very small room with tired decor. Bathroom was about the same size as the bedroom with very awkward access to shower and bath - could be dangerous with a wet floor. Whole hotel looked liked it was last reburbished in the 1970s. Plus points were the very friendly staff, free WIFI and pleasant buffet breakfast served to 11.30 weekends. Lots of much nicer hotels in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Updated Room but...lobby needs help”
Reviews.Author: tvansteenkiste
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property after traveling for 2 plus weeks so this was the last two days of a 22 day trip. The hotel lobby needs updated however the rooms were great based on what rooms in Europe look like. The room and bathroom was clean and updated. Of course as always staying in the city it was noisy at night. The hallways were also noisy late into the night. Also at check in we noticed you could prepay your breakfast at a discount and we did for 2 days and it was so bad we decided day two to cancel our reservations. They was no tour desk or consierge so it was difficult to find any help on tours

Reviews.Title: “Great location, incredibly rude staff”
Reviews.Author: elizabethcbrady
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed for one night at the Best Western Arosa on May 3rd, and I was shocked at how rude the staff was. When I called to ask a question at the front desk, they quickly answered and hung up on me before I could ask my second question. When I asked if they had a room for May 4th, they laughed in my face. The next morning, my friend and I were terribly jet lagged and overslept. After several admonishing phone calls from the staff at around 11am, an employee actually opened our room door (without knocking) while we were changing our clothes. It was very uncomfortable and we couldn't wait to get out of there after all of that. One night was PLENTY. Location and rooms were nice, but the attitude was really awful.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: clarisiza
Reviews.Content: Just back from 5 days in this hotel.I've to admit that after reading a lot of reviews I was a bit worried and i dind't expect much, so it came to a big surprise to discover that this is actually a great hotel.Location is perfect ,metro is just a few steps away and Madrid has the benus that you can actually reach the airport by metro with just 2 euro. Yes, it's true one of the lift at the hotel is very small, but that's because the builiding is very old and i'm under the impression they can't touch it, but if anything i found it very quaint! rooms were newly refurbished and quite spacious. Bathroom brand new.Yes, not all the staff speak English, but the ones that don't try their very best to make themselves understood. Breakfast was very good, a lot of fresh food and never a problem in finding a table despite being very busy. They even have a computer with free interned in their beautifully decoreted lobby. All in all a great place to discover a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location hotel tired decor”
Reviews.Author: yozzerstoke
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an executive room. I was a little disappointed as I expected luxury but the room was quite basic . We had a free mini bar which was nice and also a free safe. The staff were very friendly and the breakfast was great with lots to choose from. The drinks are expensive but you get a generous amount.(6 euros for a gin) The location is excellent close to metro which is the best way to get around. Only 5 minutes walk from an area for the ladies of the night but don't let this put you off they do not pester you. From the airport to the hotel is 2 euros. Where in the uk can you get value like that ? Madrid is a wonderful city and would recommend along with the hotel if you do not expect to much in the way of luxury .

Reviews.Title: “May stay here again”
Reviews.Author: BeachBumBunny
Reviews.Content: I stayed only 2 nights. The hotel was clean but the room I stayed in was a little outdated (room 410) it was on the Grand Via side. I live in the city of Chicago so the noise did not bother me but then too it was not that noisy either. it would have been a plus it the breakfast was included. I took a look and did not feel it was worth the price. Found a bakery near by that was excellent. The staff was friendly. The bartender at night (not sure of his name) was very nice and accommodating. The Wi-Fi worked when it wanted too. It was worst at night. The other problem was the wait if someone was on it (you get your code and can stay on it for an hour). I returned to Madrid with my niece the night before we left for Chicago. She booked it knowing I had stayed there a few days before. We were in room on the 3rd floor and I was a little pissed because this room WAS updated then my previous one. Not much of view (a construction scaffold set against the building). Not really use to sleeping in a twin bed and would have preferred 2 double beds instead. Great location, near the Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Choose another hotel”
Reviews.Author: CleaningBoy
Reviews.Content: I booked this room through the hotel website as I work in hotels and believe that if you book directly through them that you get better service, but this was not the case. I chose this hotel because of the location, the amenities such as wi-fi and because of the Best Western name. Well the hotel is cute and the rooms are pretty outdated with old and out of style appearance. The hotel website says that there is air conditioning and cable satellite television. I would not say that 20 channels with only 2 in English is good enough to calle a cable satellite. Air conditioning is another thing...the website stated their is air conditioning, but it never worked. I questioned about this at the front desk and they could not give me a direct answer as they just told me tha the rooms are controled centerally. They suggested I room move to an outside room, which they showed me, but these rooms are on Gran Via, which is very loud at all hours of the day and I knew I would not get sleep. The wi-fi did work very well and I had no problem using it with the exception of having to log on each time I turn on my computer. This hotel does have a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible bed and really noisy!!!”
Reviews.Author: PapadopoulosG
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really awful!! The room was a bit small with old furniture and the heating had always problems. The communication with the hotel staff was difficult because the majority of them spoke only Spanish. The bed was extremely uncomfortable and the walls were paper thin - we could hear talking and the hair dryer very clearly in the adjacent rooms.

Reviews.Title: “RETRO - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Smurfette081
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, retro rooms, unique elevators (trapezium). Free wifi. When it doesnt work, you can use hotel's PC (of course it has internet connection) in the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “it does exactly what it says on the tin.”
Reviews.Author: dwyer2k2
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Arosa in march 2011 and can highly recomend it.Clean rooms.Great beds.Great showers.What more does one need at this price?The only fault is the condition of the upolhostry in the reception area.....why so grubby ?iT IS OFF-PUTTING. The staff are friendly, if sometimes busy, but always helpful. And yes the elevators are the smallest I have ever seen, (even in Paris) but they do come often. Noise from the Gran Via is bareable...we brought ear-plugs having read Tripadvisor but did not need them.Rooms are clean.Would highly recomend Arosa.

Reviews.Title: “looking to stay again”
Reviews.Author: tojogger
Reviews.Content: It has takne me a while, I stayed in Sept 2009. Cant wait for my return, everything was within walking distances. I cant imagine staying anywhere else. The lift, lets say I am a big guy and there was room for me and a suit case, i took the stairs a lot. Staff were extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ramp_Runner2
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the hotel. Good location, good value. Only negative is that the hotel is not handicap accessible (as is the problem with most of Spain). Second thing to keep in mind is that the wake-up service is personal rather then computer generated. I requested a wake-up call in 15 min as I needed a catnap in the afternoon after the long flight from US. I left my wheelchair bound father in a local cafe reading the paper. They said they called (which they might have) but I never heard the phone and I overslept by a few. This left me worried when I had to catch my early morning flight on Friday.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: RobCroydon
Reviews.Content: I'm amazed by the negative comments about this hotel. We had a twin room with breakfast for £67 each for 2 nights. Breakfast is huge, hot and cold food and you can have it from 7 - 11am so what's to complain about! You can have a free glass of cava in the bar from 6 - 8pm and the hotel staff couldn't do enough for us. All of the reception staff spoke very good english. It's right on the door step for shopping and restaurants and they run a shuttle service to the hotel for 12 euros each, much cheaper than a taxi. The rooms are a little tired looking but still good sizes and yes one of the lifts is very small but it's an old building and very grand looking in all the communal aeras. I'd definitely stay there again. It was nice to be just off Gran Via and as it's down a side street it was very quiet. Thank you to all the staff who helped us during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Descen Hotel in the middle of Madrid's Gran Via”
Reviews.Author: HaifaMiu
Reviews.Content: I had ordered a business pack they proposed. For a very decent price i got type of Junior suite with gorgeous view over Gran Via, Free Pay TV and Free mini bar. Service was OK, not perfect. Generally this hotel has excellent location both for business and travel. The inside lifts are probably the smallest possible, as this is historical building and they were added later. Breakfast is average, fits the4* definition for me.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad, simply awful”
Reviews.Author: KrmiNetherlands
Reviews.Content: • Our assigned room stank of tobacco smoke. We asked for a non-smoking room . • Room 627 and 608 are very small and not at all equipped like the picture on the internet. I was not expecting suite, but the standard rooms as they are on internet look very different if the room we got. Our room was totally different from those pictures shown on the website. • There was a lot of rust and mold in the bathroom (see pictures) • View from room at dirty courtyard (see photo) • Room was hot like a sauna. After a lot of times complaining, the reception promises that someone would come and look, the housekeeper eventually discovered that the air conditioning was turned on. Because the air-conditioning wasn’t an airco it becomes very hot??? ( See photo) • Room was not cleaned on the second day. We have to ask for it several times. • Claims to be a 4 star hotel, but it's not even a 1 star hotel. • if we complain at the reception, they speak only Spanish • the positive fact - its a great location on the Gran Via -

Reviews.Title: “Good location & efficient stay for travellers”
Reviews.Author: coermask
Reviews.Content: liked location to visit many museums and palace where travellers should visit. Good price for the service and stay value. feel very efficient stay for my short trip

Reviews.Title: “central but not a 4-5 star”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Coco_nut_case
Reviews.Content: If you expect a true 5 star experience you will be dissapointed. However with the walking distance to Fuenca, La latina, Gran Via, Puerto del sol etc and with a clean and silent room (facing back "yard") with decent space, you will be happy with this hotel. Internet worked now and then, we only had the expensive breakfast last morning (not worth the 14 euro each) crazy small lift...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: xpcruiser911
Reviews.Content: We spent just one night here on a quick trip to see the main parts of the city. The hotel was exactly what we needed. It's about a 40 minute subway ride from airport and within walking distance of everything in the center of Madrid. It was a little tough to find (sign was covered by scaffolding), but after you know where it is, it's easy. The room was clean and bathroom was really nice. Free internet is available as well. As mentioned before, one of the elevators is VERY small and the beds are firm. Neither was an issue for us. I would absolutely come back again, especially for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Chart68
Reviews.Content: Hotel was on the Grand Via the rooms were clean & sufficient for our purposes. Maid service was daily (dont use just love it when someone else makes your bed :-) ) Reception were very helpful as was the doorman when we left. Hotel bar was a bit pricey but the measures made up for the price! The Grand Via is a very busy road whatever time of day but the double gazing shut out the noise. Starbucks across the road was great for morning coffee & a crossiant as was Mc Cafe in McDonalds!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, Friendly and helpful staff, good value for money and excellent food, especially in their sushi restaurant. Very nice breakfast. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rates”
Reviews.Author: Buffalo0033
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, we decided to stay at the Arosa. The hotel is very centrally located near shopping, across the street from the bus stop & Starbucks. Shopping is all around this hotel as are restaurants. We loved Garbos - less than a block away which had something for everyone on the menu. The cost was about half of what other comparable hotels were getting. I would highly recommend this hotel - very clean, very nice, great price, great location. They also have non-smoking floors. This hotel does not have an indoor pool - some sites we found stated that it did. Indoor pools are not at all popular in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but...”
Reviews.Author: edwie
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel due to a magnificent offer they had on Expedia. I've stayed in Gran Via before, so I had already seen it. Read reviews, was a little skeptical but I guessed, why not... I booked a single room for one week. When I arrived to the hotel, discovered that the reception is on the SECOND floor. There are 2 elevators: A standard one, and then the smallest elevator in the world!! You can't fit in there with your suitcases. They are slowww... I went to register and asked for a room with view to Gran Via. They gave me a room on the top floor and it smelled like death. View was magnificent but I opened the windows to see if the fresh air would get rid of the smell. Wrong! Add to that, the internet was not working up there. The room was nice, but the smell killed it for me. So I immediately went down and asked for a room change. They said they didnt have any more single rooms with view to Gran Via but at that point I didnt care. They gave me a room with a view to the side street in the older wing of the hotel. What a pleasant surprise! It was considerably older looking than the other room (Decor and furniture speaking) but it was BIG! A single room with a full sized bed, the internet worked perfectly and the bathroom was spacious. I thought they had given me a double room by mistake so I needed to clear that up before they charged up my cc.... but no, it was a single room. The hotel is being remodeled so there are pieces of cloth covering the hallway carpets. The location is excellent, but for such a demanded hotel, two slow elevators don't cut it... do not stay here for over $100 a night... stay if there is an offer. If you are a solo traveler, make sure they put you in a single room on the old side of the building... these are big and comfortable. The other ones are very small. Would I stay here again? I dont think so, for 20 extra bucks a night you can stay at the BW Atlantico.. the #1 hotel in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great deal!”
Reviews.Author: P_M_T2010
Reviews.Content: Great location, just one step to Gran Via. Less than 5 min walking from metro stations. I originally booked a non smoking room and they put us in a smoking room. We asked the staff to change the room and we were promptly attended. I'm not sure, but I think they have just one floor for non smoking rooms (the last one) and this floor seems to be newer than other ones. Room is good, but could be have more lights. It's a little bit dark at night. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend. It's a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: lemonloaf
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, just off Gran Via. Easily accessibly by metro. Able to walk to all the major sights. No frills, basic hotel. The elevators are tiny - can only fit me with my backpack on my back and a suitcase by my side. The place seemed dated. The internet didn't always connect. However, it was clean, quiet, and smoke free. Found a special price online so great for value.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Western”
Reviews.Author: Veron_Ulonen
Reviews.Content: Claims to be a 4 star hotel, but it's not even a 1 star hotel. World's smallest and slowest elevators. The smaller one barely fitted two persons and ran up and down to whichever floor, regardless what button was pressed. Lobby stank of tobacco smoke. Room had a nauseating reek. We had booked a room for a week, but cancelled our stay there. We didn't even ask for a refund, just wanted to get the hell out of there. On departure neither of the elevators were functioning and we had to carry our luggage down several floors. Totally ruined our holiday. Worst hotel we've ever been in. Avoid!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and centrally located.”
