Reviews.Author: romagaro
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for five nights in the middle of September. It is conveniently located just off the Gran Via, and only about 100 yards from the nearest Metro station, "Gran Via". It is within easy walking distance of the central tourist attractions of Madrid, such as the Palacio Real, the Plaza Mayor, and the bars & restaurants of the Puerta del Sol area. The second floor reception is staffed by friendly, knowledgeable staff, who all speak English. Our room, which was on the sixth floor, overlooking the Gran Via, could have been troubled by street noise, as the Gran Via is a busy main thoroughfare, but it was fully air conditioned so the double glazed windows could remain closed. The maid kept the room immaculate during our stay, and always had a nice attitude to us whenever we saw her.. The only down side in the room was the lack of tea/coffee making facilities, which we had been led to believe would be provided. We took the buffet breakfast in the hotel each day of our stay, which was good and represented good value at 8.40 EUR per head per day. Another nice touch in the public area adjacent to the reception was the free provision of internet access. I would have no problem about staying in this hotel on any future visit to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “very accessible”
Reviews.Author: eyy
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very conviniently accessible to Gran Via (shopping area). It is just walking distance basically to everything. Hop-on hop-off tour bus it just across the street. Metro is just few meters away. Biggest mall (La Vaguada) can be reached by Metro just get off at Barrio del pilar station. When you turn right from Arosa hotel and walk straight ahead, it will get you to "Sol" area which is the center for everything. Sol is crowded with people, so you should take care of your personal belongings. Hotel room was clean but the mattress is sunken and pillows are tiny like kids pillows, sleeping was a liitle bit uncomfortable. We just got a good booking deal that provide Free buffet breakfast, Free mini bar and Free pay-TV. With these freebies it was indeed a great deal for an European Hotel. The staff are courteous and help us with our inquiry. One thing is the elevator. It was the first time I've seen and get into an elevator that is almost triangular in shape about 45 degree angle and would only fit 2 person confortablly. Which is very hard if you got lot of luggages, coz the reception area is located on the 2nd floor. From the Barajas airport, taxi will cost approximately 30-38 Euro. But if you decide to take shuttle bus, this need to be pre arrange with Arosa hotel before your arrival. Suttle bus cost 12 Euro. Just be sure when you take shuttle bus going back to the airport, give an allowance to your time because you are not their only passenger they will still pick up other guest from various hotel before driving you back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and professional staff”
Reviews.Author: Glad_Resenar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a weekend in Best Western Hotel Arosa in July 2010 and we really enjoyed our stay. The rooms were clean and the staff was always willing to help us. Our room was facing Gran Via, what a view! It was a wonderful holiday, we will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great price!”
Reviews.Author: AdsnBex
Reviews.Content: This is the first review I have ever done, and the only reason I have done it is because I was amazed by this hotel and the city of Madrid. Upon arrival at Barajas airport we took a taxi to the Gran Via, was about 35 Euros, including the airport pick up fee. We arrived at the hotel an hour early but had no problems checking in, the entrance is actually down a side street off the Gran Via, the lifts are incredibly small but this just added to the authenticity of the place, dont expect to fit more than two people and a suitcase in the lifts! Our room was on the 5th floor, if you are scared of heights ask for a room low down, as the only problem with the room is that if you open the French door style windows, directly below is the Gran Via, and the only thing seperating yourself and the air is a knee high railing. The bathroom was rather impressive and came with a mini hair dryer, although this was not much use, however you can ask at reception for an English plug adapter for no extra fee. The bedroom served a purpose and the beding was cleaned daily, along with the towels. Our room overlooked the Gran Via and at night time was very noisy, this was mainly on the Friday night as Atletico Madrid won the European Super Cup and there were large amounts of supporters celebrating, we would of been celebrating with them at 2am if we hadnt woken up at 2am the previous morning to get to Heathrow! We didnt eat at the hotel at all as we were out exploring the city, a couple of tips: - If you stay here you won't need to use the metro other than to get to the Airport and Santiago Barnabue, everything else is in walking distance. - Do not bother going out in the evening before 9pm for drinks/food, it starts getting buzzy at around 10.30pm. - A great restaraunt at great value is Turf, which is in the Heurtes neighbourhood in a plaza called Plaza Santa Ana. Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Madrid for your Euro!”
Reviews.Author: KBCoolio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Arosa for two nights for EUR 69 per night. The rooms were clean and adequate with reasonable space. Good climate control in room. The hotel was located in a very convenient location steps away from Calle Gran Via. The included breakfast buffet was great with large selection of pastries, meats, eggs, coffee, juice, cereals, etc. Concierge desk was very helpful and friendly. The only negative was the very tight elevators which fit only two people with luggage. We would highly recommend and stay there again. Pros: Location, Breakfast, Price Cons: Small elevator

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother, left over panties from a previous guest in our room, not worth any euros”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust1979
Reviews.Content: Hubby & I only booked one night, thank goodness!!! On our arrival we knew this wasnt good. The reception desk/area is on the 2nd floor. First we had to walk up a few steps to the elevator with no one greeting us or to help with heavy luggage because there was no bell boy. The elevator was soooo tiny (no jokes!, tiny, can barely fit two people so if you are with a family of 4-5, they need to wait for the next elevator). At the reception desk, there was a couple complaining about theft (in spanish) the receptionist asked us if we spoke spanish & we lied so we heard everything about the theft. Hallways & Room: hallways are dirty & smell of cigarette. We were in a non-smoking floor & room, why was there 2 ash trays in the room? Who ever was smoking, we could smell it in the bathroom vents. The walls are as thin as paper. Out next door neighbor left his TV on all night while they left for the evening. It was loud until 330am, we called to tell them about it earlier during the evening but nothing was done. On our way out the next morning, I was checking if we had left anything & checked the under the bed & there was a left over panties from a previous guest ??? must be old because it was dusty under the bed...

Reviews.Title: “central and adequate”
Reviews.Author: Will de d
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Best Western Arosa for four nights in a single room arriving on July 10 and departing on July 14, 2010. I am a member of Best Western rewards and have spend many nights in hotels of this chain. The Best Western Arosa is alright, but definitely not a four star hotel, with exception of the prices of the items in the minibar and the prices of the laundry service. They are grossly overpriced. The single room I stayed in was tiny and the smallest ever in a hotel that is supposed to have four stars. The bathroom wan't very large either, but both bedroom and bathroom were clean. As i almost hotels these days, you have to specifically ask if you want a change of sheets and towels. The best abouth this hotel is the great location. Around the corner of the Gran Via, five minutes away from the Puerta Sol and ten minutes from the Plaza Mayor. It is a shame that there are many prostitutes only two streets away who aproach every single male with the offer of a cheap blow job. The police should really do something about that because Madrid in July is much to hot for any of that kind of action. The reception of the hotel is on the second floor and sometimes (not very often) there is a doorman at the frontdoor. The English that is spoken at reception is very basic, but that is the same everywere in Madrid. In Madrid schools clearly don't put a lot of emphasis on learning children foreign languages. In Lisbon or Barcelona almost everyone speaks English, but in Madrid you have to look very hard to find someone who does, even in the tourist industry. Back to the hotel. The elevators are tiny and can only hold up to four (not to heavy) people) at the same time and less if you have luggage. Don't bother with the breakfast. It really is worth €13,95. There are enough places closeby that will provide a decent breakfast for around €5. And do visit on of the shops of the Museo the Jamon near the Puerto Sol. Beer, wine, sandwiches (ham, chorizo, cheese), all for €1 an item. But you have to stand at the bar. For someone used to the standard of a Best Western the Best Western Arosa in Madrid is a bit of a disappointment. But if you can get the Best Western Arosa for a decent price, it is an adequate hotel for a couple of nights. But the rooms really aren't worth any more than €50 for a single or €80 for a double a night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, minutes walk from the centre of town”
Reviews.Author: albonator316
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a fantastic location, minutes walk from great shops and restaurants. The room has air con and free wireless internet. Staff were helpful and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: JM_Bushwick
Reviews.Content: I will keep this short, the hotel was dirty, the service was horrible. The bathroom was full of hair and dusty. The room I had was a good size and was quite and the free breakfast were the only good things about this place. While the hotel was located on the Grand Via, I recommand that you spend more money and stay far, far away from there. What about the elavators...one of them was so small that only one person and their suit case fit there at a time. Don't stay here...the few bucks you save is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but very noisy with a scarce breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Bliuma
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in a row. The service is ok; the only two lifts all together can take max. 7 poeple. And on their way and down they stop and open the doors at a reception, which is on the second floor. And this is for at least 6 storey building and 126 rooms. The rooms are quite ok (for the level of Spain), but if the windows overlook Gran Via - expect to be disturbed by all the noise of traffic and crowds of poeple at one of the busiest streets in Madrid. The breakfast is really a shame. The only really good thing about the hotel is its superb location - it's in the center, it's with an easy access to several metro lines and it's always easy to find your way to the hotel. But having stayed in other 4 start hotels in Madrid (e.g. Santo Domingo) - I defnitely do not want to return to Arosa.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok”
Reviews.Author: DjsTrip
Reviews.Content: Location was great, and the Gran Via metro was very very close. Other than that, the place is a bit of a dud. Wifi didn't work, rooms are getting rundown. (the staff still gave me the wifi password, with no mention that the wifi wasn't working. only after I complained that they admitted that wifi was down for a couple more days) If location is all you care about, you might be ok staying here, if the price is right. Not a 4 star hotel by any stretch of the imagination.

Reviews.Title: “hotel arosa best location possible”
Reviews.Author: zeeva
Reviews.Content: we are at the moment at the hotel, we came for 2 days and have enjoyed every moment. the location is central and we are walking to all the main attractions, the bars nd the restaurants. It is also a shoppers haven since the area is full of the main department stores. Since we came by car we were very worried about the parking possibilities. but after checking in we parked at a public parking at thr Plaza Carmen, whic is situated right behind the hotel. Buffet Breakfast was very nice, We definitely recommend this hotel for a short visit to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Basically, dont stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_traveller32
Reviews.Content: It seems to be the norm with Madrid hotels on the GranVia. It seems that if they put a hotel 'on the strip' they dont have to do any upkeep of their rooms, the staff's attitudes are disgusting, Because their hotels are so centrally located 'people have to stay there' this maybe true, but do some proper research and choose wisely. i have just stayed at the Best Western Arosa and was given room 504. DISGUSTING, DIRTY, Incredibly small, and a awful bathroom. I spoke to the staff on the day and they wasn't bothered, they kept say "no more rooms" . the walls are made of like a duvet kind of material, splattered with food. The room was dirty with a hair scrunchie under the bed, hair in the room, hair in the bathroom, broken tiles, completely unacceptable. When i returned i contacted their customer services dept. i emailed and waited nearly 3 weeks for a response after it had been passed from dept to dept. they come back with. Dear Mr. Brookes, the hotel have decided that this hotel has NORMAL WEAR AND TEAR. normal wear and tear must include the hotel room not being cleaned properly. Best Western I salute you for the most ridiculous response you can ever give a customer who has paid to stay in one of your hotels. I certainly wont be staying in thes hotel or the other Best Western Hotels your trying to flog us at the moment with your massive advertising campaign in England. I can see right through it. im hoping ithers will follow suit and stay the hell away form your hotels. MR BEST WESTERN. normal wear and tear i understand. FOOD ON THE WALLS THAT HAVE TRIED TO BE CLEANED, HAIR ON THE FLOOR, RUBBISH UNDER THE BED. this is not normal wear and tear, it is completely unacceptable and should NEVER happen for hygiene reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Central Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TomoPortHedland
Reviews.Content: Very clean and comfortable hotel located in the heart of the city. Staff can speak fairly good english and are very helpful in guiding you around the city. Breakfast was good and if you book at reception when you arrive for your full stay receive 40% discount. This Hotel good valve for money and a great location

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - if you get it at a discount.”
Reviews.Author: EddieSk1
Reviews.Content: A positively average hotel. Claims to be 4 star in its literature but...is not, decent 3 star at best. The staff are efficient and well able to deal with english speaking customers. Its biggest problem is its total lack of atmosphere - like staying in a poor interior design magazine layout. I never got to meet any of the other guests as, apart from sleeping and bathing, there was no reason to be in the hotel. I had the room next to the service room but that was OK. The cleaners might start at 8.00 AM but were not that noisy. One day I slept 'til 1.00 PM. The work that they do is faultless and when I returned after a hard days work, the room was perfection. I was able to leave out paperwork and my laptop and whatever and find the room tidied but undisturbed when I returned. . The lifts are ludicrous and you'll probably only use them to go up with your luggage and never use them again. Internet access from my laptop in my room was free but I had huge problems with it. It was unsecured and slow and every twenty minutes or so would cut out completely and needed to be re-logged in to the hotel server. Not a lot of fun if you were trying to get some work done. For a city break in Madrid, this hotel is perfect - you will be in the centre of the city and everything is nearby. The streets do get a little seedy after dark (actually a good bit seedy) but it is a major city and all cities have a dark side and in this case it the dark side is literally on your doorstep. I stayed for a week and got on chatting terms with the prostitute who works the corner by the bookshop. That's just a by-the-by and has nothing t do with the hotel itself. You get what you pay for and if you do not pay the going rate for this hotel you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star like... but ok for city trip”
Reviews.Author: Citytripper85
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately the hotel was not 4 star like. rooms were very small. little tv... smoker room but no balcony! very strange elevators and we heard everything from neighbors room. at all time (even night) you can hear the police outside (Gran Via) even if the window is closed... we espected a bit more from a 4 star hotel, but it was ok for a city trip only. plaza del sol is very near, even if you want to go shopping, you have all there (Gran Via, Plaza del Sol etc.) Metro is also there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you get it at right price...”
Reviews.Author: mferia
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for high-class, upper four stars then Arosa is not the place for you. If you are looking for a hotel in a great location (right off of Gran Via, near Plaza Mayor), free WiFi, good breakfast (don't get the other reviews on this - I enjoyed their breakfast), good beds, safe in the room, attentive staff...then stay here. (Be sure to take advantage of the airport shuttle - you must book it the day before you depart at the reception desk - its only 12 Euro per person). Few tips and disclaimers...if you go in knowing that the reception is on the 2nd floor and the elevators are a joke - your stay will be much more enjoyable :) If you get an old room, as I did on check in, politely ask them for a room that is more updated and looks like the one advertised on the internet and they will be more than happy to accomodate you - as they did for me. The difference between the old and new room is immense - so like I said, if you get an old one, be sure to request a new/updated room!! Makes a HUGE difference! I would return to Arosa and would recommend it to my friends only after I gave them the above tips and disclaimers. And really - the location cannot get any better than this!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel , not 4 star though”
Reviews.Author: icebergjoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a couple of nights and got the room for 50 odd euros a night . Rooms were fine had no problems with any off the staff ,and it is a perfect location for the center of Madrid . If you get a deal on it go for it , I wouldnt have been happy if I had paid full price for it though.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Pretentious and not as it seems as online- Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: profit105
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this establishment (note I didnt write Hotel) Feb 6th to 9th 2010. Double room was in no way resembling the rooms as viewed on hotel website( booked thru 1800hotels.com -who bythe way didnt want to know when i complained). This is a pretentious establishment trying to be something it is not. False grandeur as viewd in the chieck in area is just that false and dirty. Staff are just about ok. I complained that room allocated upon check in was not acceptable. Crazy wallpaper (room503) - window opening into an inner atrium with views of a rooms strewn in cigarette buts. Managed to get a different room. furniture is old and and total establishment needs to be decorated. back of one of the beds had a hole punched into it. Breakfast was awful. Decided not to eat breakfast even though i had paid for it. Under no circumstances could i recommend this establishment. Stay away. Dirty and places are filthy. The lift in this establishment is laughable - one lift is a triangle with room for just about 2 small adults and a suitcase. This is an Alice in Wonderland extablishment, Again, I advise stay away. And not not book thru 1800hotels.com - they dont want to know about a complaint - simply not interested. I have photos but 1800hotels were not interested in seeing them. Please not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “This is SO not 4 Star ....”
Reviews.Author: anthonyhawke
Reviews.Content: Stayed 12-15 February, 2010. Good points? Not many. Hotel is very tired in appearance. In our room (Room 512 used by a previously and obviously smoking occupant/s) no usual toiletries in the bathroom, just a squeezy bottle of soap/shampoo. No coffee or tea making facilities. Walls paper thin, so any noise from the corridor/next room, easily heard. I was woken at 3am in the morning by revellers (lucky them, and thanks for sharing your happiness). Buffet breakfast really awful with scrambled egg the likes of which I have never seen - eggs in strips!! Whole place lacks any soul or charm. The reception is like the bridge of the Titantic (just) before the collision. This is so very disappointing as a Best Western. The location is great in the old City. Shame about the hotel. Occupants in rooms on the front of the hotel (Gran Via) take earplugs - (don't believe me? I have video and audio). I have details of the best deal off the Puerto del Sol. Amazing little restaurant and such amazing value. Beer in hotel Euro 3.80 but 60 cents in the supermarket. The bar has the ambience of a plank.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!!!!! Lazy Nasty Staff”
Reviews.Author: ML0418
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights when I was alone and left a bag there because I had another reservation for the Jan. 2 for 2 rooms. I decided to cancel the rooms on Jan 2 and went into the hotel to cancel and pick up my bag on Dec,26th The hotel clerk was completely annoyed and told me that he would cancel it butI needed to call Best Western. I did both and was still charged for not cancelling. This was the general mood by the staff. The attitude was the same when my flight was delayed and I called to say I was checking in late The desk staff was annoyed. I was not the only person delayed on that night. Aside for my personal inconvience, the room was small, the hall dirty and the elevators so small that going up and down took forever. i will say the location was great but so are many other hotels with helpful front desk staff. I will be reviewing one that was across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but definitely not a 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: _Wanderer__24242_
Reviews.Content: Hotel's location is convenient, right on Gran Via and 200m from Gran Via metro station. Unfortunately the hotel is not really a 4* hotel. The reception is on the 2nd floor (reached via two really narrow elevators), the room room and public spaces interiors are dated, bathroom fittings are very outdated. It was noisy in the room due to heavy traffic on Gran Via and antiquated, inappropriate glazing. On the positive side, the breakfast was quite good, with fresh fruits and jamon. We have paid 75 euro for a double room with breakfast, and this is probably an adequate price for what we got. Not a 4* star hotel, though.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but very small room”
Reviews.Author: Iram77
Reviews.Content: The hotel in general is ok, but as i read in other reviews, the walls in the rooms are very thin so yes you can hear everything that is happenning in the other rooms and on the street, besides since my room was the last one in the hall, i could hear the cleaning staff every time they passed through there from the emergency stairs. The bed wasn't the best, and the sheets were a bit old with some holes in them. The room was very small, and it is true what they say, the staff isnt very nice, when i asked if they could call a taxi for me they just said, just go out and take one in Gran Via. The good part of it, is that is just in downtown, very close to everything. And the prices i payed for the room wasn't very expensive. But anyway i wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location”
Reviews.Author: Vale23
Reviews.Content: This hotel may not abide to the 4 stars standard regarding the room dimensions and for the fact that they do not offer free breakfast, but its location is undoubtedly great. The hotel is located in the middle of the Gran Via, one of the most important and central streets in Madrid. From the hotel, you can get almost anywhere in Madrid by foot, except for instance the Santiago Bernabeu Stadium. The traffic is quite heavy on the Gran Via, but the rooms are adequatelly soundproof, we didn't miss a minute sleep. Rooms are small but clean, besides, you don't really need a suite when you're visiting a city, do you? The hotel is also ideally located in front of a Starbucks Coffe bar; as the hotel's not offering free breakfast, I'd say this is quite a good thing. The underground station Gran Via is about 50 meters from the hotel, and the Callao Station is at about 200

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: K2Cal
Reviews.Content: I had a single room -- which was literally that -- a single bed. The room was very clean (as was the private bathroom) and recently updated -- nicely modern. My room's window faced the inner courtyard -- so no view, but fresh air if you wanted it. Staff was friendly and I got very prompt service when I had difficulty with the safe. Free Wifi was great. I used the mini bar to store my own juice, yogurt, etc. Location, location, location -- I was able to walk everywhere I wanted. Incredibly central. The only negative point I would make is that there seemed to be an odour from the drains, but if I kept the bathroom door closed while out it wasn't noticeable. I have a very sensitive nose -- so the odour may not be noticeable to others. I got a screaming deal from Expedia -- was only 50 Euros per night, including all taxes and charges.

Reviews.Title: “Rather disappointing”
Reviews.Author: relevart2006
Reviews.Content: Positives: Great location – close to many metro stops, and in the center of town. Walking distance to Prado Museum, great restaurants, and plenty of shopping. The room was clean and the bed was pretty comfortable. Free wireless internet. Negatives: The walls were really, really thin! I could hear every word being said in room next door. Not fun when these neighbors are out until 4:00 am, come back to hotel drunk and loud. The staff didn’t go out of their way to be friendly--didn’t even smile at us. I didn’t feel like a valued customer. Rooms are older and small. Some things in disrepair – toilet seat cover broken, balcony door wouldn’t open, hallway carpet is worn and stained. Website photos make the property look much more glamorous than it actually is. Overall not worth the price. Perhaps the hotel would be better suited to the nightlife crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Subpar Experience”
Reviews.Author: PlainVanilla
Reviews.Content: I was REALLY debating whether or not to give this place 2 stars, but I decided to be generous. I found this property to be very much of a mixed bag. Now don't misunderstand; I'm not a total novice a European hotel standards. If you look (as I have) at other Madrid hotel reviews, you see a recurring theme; room size, noise and lack of customer courtesy by the staff. This place had ALL of these issues, but I only cite them as a negative when they go beyond what I consider acceptable even given the location of the property.On the plus side, the common area and reception were very nice and in good shape, my room (such as it was) was clean and the cleaning staff did a good job keeping up with it. Also, as others have pointed out, it is in a very central location. On the negative side, however: my single room was a tiny monastery-like cubicle, without the good beer. Literally maybe 6 x 10 feet, and with a bed hard enough to fit in county lockup. That wouldn't have been a huge issue, though, if it wasn't for the noise. The location of this property (just off Gran Via) was a real negative in terms of traffic noise, and you can hear ALL of it like you were on the sidewalk with newpapers covering you (in fact the bed was somewhat similar to a sidewalk). I actually was given a room with a balocony overlooking the street, which was nice (heck, the hotel staff may have even thought that they were doing me a favor), but even on the 8th floor, the noise at night was extreme - and I am not one of those light sleepers. That was not the worst of it, though. My room was also right next to the maid service room, and you could hear every bang, thud and creak coming from there. I can attest that they were a hard working bunch that kept extemely long hours. Finally, I also want to echo what has been reported by other reviewers; the hotel reception staff is quite unfriendly. This to me is unforgivable. WHY would someone go into the "hospitality" industry if they couldn't at least pretend that they liked people?? I mean, look....we don't need to go pick out curtains. I just expect a modicum of courtesy and professionalism, rather than sighs of "I wish I was getting a root canal" when I check in. Come to think about it, I'm changing my rating to two stars. All in all, if you get this place at what passes with the current exchange rate at a good price, I guess you could consider it, but i know there are better places for the dollar in Madrid, becuase when I cencked out of here (after 5 days), I checked into one, where I;m currently staying. This place has some smaller issues, too, but as far as room size, noise and friendly staff; much, much better. Last two points: the complimentary wi-fi was in good working order and quite fast. Also, the breakfast was pretty good, too (although at 13+ Euros not free, but not unreasonably expensive for a hotel meal). It also has a fitness center, which was a plus (closes at 10PM).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Well maintained, Staff OK.”
Reviews.Author: Bluechip78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in November, The hotel has a great location as it's near to the shopping and sights and for the longer trips around the city it's right beside the metro. The rooms are clean but a bit small. The staff are reasonable but not overly helpful. If you spoke Spanish i suspect you may have a better time communicating, however we had no problems but we we not asking for anything that you would not expect to be asking at a hotel reception. Overall, for the price we paid and the location of the hotel it's worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Worse experience in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelerSnob
Reviews.Content: This hotel says its 4 stars and it is nothing but. We had the worse time in this hotel - mainly to do with the rude, uncaring and unfriendly staff members (esp the female ones). We got robbed of all our personal items in Barcelona and were in Madrid to apply for our emergency passports. We weren't looking for sympathy, but just a little kindness, help and understanding. Instead, we were met with cold stares and indifferent attitudes - everything we asked the reception was always a "no". Eg. we needed to make a few phone calls to ensure that our homeward journey was going to be a smooth sailing one but all the voice recordings were in Spanish. The lady at the reception refused to assist us in connecting to an operator!! It was only after I questioned their 4 star hotel status that a male staff offered to help. If you need to go to Madrid, don't stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay - worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: robstrash
Reviews.Content: I only had 1 night in Madrid and am glad I chose the Best Western Arosa. The hotel is a great location and very close to the Gran Via metro stop. The wireless internet and tasty breakfast were included so it made it even more worthwhile. The rooms are not large, but not tiny either. The only issue I had was that the room was warm so I turned on the AC and set to the lowest setting and put the fan on high. I was still warm so opened the window to let cool air in. I was sitting on the bed next to the window and got up an hour later and the room was even hotter. Turns out that even though I had the thermostat set to 10 and AC on, the heat was actually on and making the room hotter. Once I turned the thermostat off, the room cooled down with the open window. Also, if you are coming from the airport via the metro, be careful if you have luggage. You have to transfer trains 2 times which isn't bad unless you have some big luggage because there are about 2-3 sets of stairs. I only had a small bag so it was no problem but if you had a large suitcase it would be inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Clean, but Staff is Indifferent”
Reviews.Author: xlnja
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, right off Gran Via and very close to the major sight seeing areas of Old Madrid. I was also very impressed with the cleanliness of the room and the new fixtures and decor. I travel a lot for work and stay in hotels every week. I usually don't expect much from the hotel staff. I just like a nice place to sleep and that's about it. However, I distinctly noticed that the hotel staff is not friendly or welcoming. I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and had to go to the front desk a few times. Not once did any of the hotel staff smile or make me feel welcome. I felt more like I was inconveniencing them. For this reason, I am giving the hotel 3 stars instead of 4.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: Karaliayfer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel between 21-25 October; from the reviews I was a bit apprehensive however we really liked the hotel and the staff were very helpfull. The hotel is on Gran via steps away from the metro station; so convenient. We stayed in non-smoking room on the 5th floor in twin bedded room because a double room was not available at the time of booking. The room and bathroom was spacious so it did not bother us styaing in the twin room. I booked the room through Octopus Travel; provided the best price and included breakfast which was convenient included cooked breakfast; cereals, fruit, yoghurt everything it was very good. All the other providers did not included the breakfast in the price, which I disagree; a hotel should always include breakfast. The hotel is 5 minutes away from Puerta del Sol; which is the main attraction and Plaza Mayor; Royal Palace. We walked everywhere; therfore it's an idea not to purchase 3 or 4 days passes that you can buy to travel in metro and on busses; because you can walk everywhere from the hotel; including Museo Del Prado. While in Madrid it's an idea to travel to Toledo, which is 1/2 hour away from Atocha station again you can walk from the hotel to Atocha station; takes about 15-20 minutes. If you are travelling at the weekend; it can be very busy; make sure the agent books your tickets next to each other; because in our case she booked us completley in different carriage and sitting areas; luckyly realised it before the departure and changed it. One of the places you should try to eat is Museo Del Hamon; abundance of cured meat; cheese (Oveja and Manchego is the main ones); wonderfull succulent calamaries; fish dishes and lovely warm baked bread in the premises. This place is always busy; non stop; the food is alot cheaper then the other similar delicatassen places. If you eat at the bar is cheaper then sitting down; it's entirely up to you. I find it sitting down more comfortable and enjoyable. Museo Del Hamon is a must! place.www.museodeljamon.es

Reviews.Title: “Just location worth the price”
Reviews.Author: coringax
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 3 nights, beginning of october. The reception team is no friendly and they want to do with guests as fast as they can (my feeling). My room was incredibly small and there were pieces falling on the ceiling. My bag almost didn't fit in there. The elevators are definetely unique; they should be on guiness as for their incredibly small size, never seen that..one/ max 2 per time. Despite all that, I must recognize that is a great location and you pretty much can walk all over the touristic places if you like it as I do. Also is close to a main street with plenty places to eat and metros. Used the shuttle service offered for 12 euro at the reception, to go back to airport. With a big back that sounded a good option. The receptionists are not very good with english too. If you're looking for center location this might be a good choice, but if you expect a big room for your bags or something else.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: ChorleyLancslady
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the arosa on 3 October for 3 nights. Hotel in good location, on a side street off the Grand via. Had a reburbished room which was nice, with good bathroom, and balcony. Madrid fab city. Stay away from drinking in the Plaza Major as it costs a fortune. Good bars and tapas bars around the Plaza Santa Ana and not as expensive! This is about 5/10 mins walk away. can walk around the city easily. Had breakfast in a couple fo different coffee shops for about 2 or 3 euros. Lots of palces to eat and drink. Got a shuttle bus from the hotel back to the airport for 12 euros pp. Cheaper than a taxi, but more expensive than the underground.

Reviews.Title: “2 and a half star hotel with GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: skeez
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at the Arosa for 4 nights recently. We'd booked online for a non-smoking room with a view, and the first room they tried to give us was room 301 on the 3rd floor. It was a newly refurbished room, BUT it was dark, and it smelled heavily of smoke. We went back to the reception and requested for another room. This time they let us pick from 2 rooms, one is room 703 on the 5th floor. Also newly refurbished with a nice bathroom and all, BUT the view was of the corner of the building!! the curtains would have to be drawn all the time for another window looks into this room!!! The 3rd room we looked at was the one we finally picked. Room 510. Though it was clearly a room on a floor that has not seen any renovation in decades, at least it smelled smoke free and it has a view of the Grand Via, which we liked. The bathroom was really old, with cracked tile floors, gaudy blue toilet and matching blue sink with a cold water tap that doesn't shut easily, and a towel rack that's on the verge of collapse. We've been travelling in spain for 2 and a half weeks prior to arriving in madrid and this was clearly the worst room we've been in!!! The saving grace was the free WIFI though you have to go down to the reception to get the login and password, and it's only valid for 72 hours, so if u stay for more than 3 days, you would need to get another set to get online. I don't know how this can be a 4 star hotel... for the only thing great about it is its LOCATION!!! we didn't get breakfast at the hotel, but my husband's brother who also stayed at the hotel did, and they said it wasn't a very good spread. we picked this hotel only because we wanted to stay in the same hotel with the family we were meeting in madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location. Good value. Free wifi throughout hotel. Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: travel4workandplay
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a 1 night business trip in Madrid. I took the train from Barajas (Madrid Airport) to Gran Via which is a stones throw from the hotel. The train trip takes about 45 minutes and you have to change train twice but it is very easy and only costs 2 euros (compared to 30+ euros for a cab). The trains are very efficient and clean and comfortable. The hotel is brilliantly located for Gran Via, Sol and only a few minutes to walk to the beautiful Plaza Mayor. The room was small with a single bed but very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was pretty small but quite nice and a fantastically powerful shower. Free wifi throughout the hotel. Hotel staff are very helpful and friendly. I had a late flight out of Madrid and they were accomodating in letting me stay and work in the reception area to work until late evening.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but great location and good value!”
Reviews.Author: tiffany000
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Sept 2009 for 3 nights. Although this hotel is very basic, it is clean, a good value and excellent location on the busy Gran Via. I booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and everyone is pretty much right on. If you are looking for a hotel just to sleep and in a good location - this is it! I would say the hotel itself is a 3 star, but I give it a 4 because of the location. I stayed in a single room for about $60 US dollars per night. When I checked in I asked for a quite room (reviews say Gran Via is very loud, which it is). The clerk gave me keys to two types of rooms and let me choose. The 1st room was not on the busy street, quiter, but VERY OLD and run down. The 2nd room I chose was facing Gran Via, but much nicer with hardwood floors and a larger bathroom with full tub/shower (not very common in Europe). Gran Via is loud and sirens go on all day and night (fire station a few blocks away), but the views are great. Every morning I would wake up and stand on my balcony and just look at the craziness going by. The location really is great. Starbucks and H&M are right across the street from the hotel. A few blocks behind the hotel is blocks and blocks of shopping and restaurants. Plaza Mayor and Puerto Del Sol are a very close walk (window shop along the way). I might stay here again, just because it was so inexpensive and clean and did the job...but if you are looking for somewhere with more atmosphere, then I would look elsewhere. The lobby area is very outdated and no action. I pretty much just showered and slept in the room. If you are looking for a great plaza that has the biggest concentration of Tapas Bars, walk about 10 minutes to Plaza Santa Ana. Its super crowded at night and has lots of action going on. METRO DIRECTIONS FROM AIRPORT: It was very easy to take the Metro - 2 euro ticket. About a 40 minute ride. Take #8 (pink line) to Nuevo Ministerios, then #10 (blue line) to Alonso Martinez, then #5 (green) to Gran Via. The hotel is about 2 blocks from the subway stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MGC78
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in this hotel and I can't think of a better location for those looking to do sightseeing, shopping and bar crawling. Metro station is 2 blocks away, internet cafe, everything you can think of. The reception staff and porters were very helpful. The only downside is housekeeping, as I had to call reception at 10 pm to ask for toilet paper! and in spite of hanging the towels on the rails (as indicated to save water), they were changed 3 times, but the glasses for drinking water were left dirty for 3 days. Note that the hotel is not really modern and in general rooms are pretty basic, without any spectacular views or flat screen tv, but the price is very reasonable and if you are planning on spending any more than 8 hours in your room, then you are wasting your time in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Quite grand!!”
Reviews.Author: voyager-09
Reviews.Content: As locations go, this hotel has a lot going for it. Being right on the Gran Via in Madrid where it all happens is a prime spot. I've never stayed in a Spanish hotel which had a concierge before so I felt like I had moved up in the world!! THe room I was given was on the 4th floor of a very elegant building and was actually quite large. From it I had a great view of the Gran Via itself. The one and only snag was the noise from the traffic could be heard quite plainly both day and night despite the room having an outside and inside window. Once I grew accustomed to this, I slept really well. Breakfast was served on the same floor as the reception and even the fussiest eater would have no complaints. This is a VERY centrally-located hotel, with charm and a touch of class - perfect for short city break in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very clean room, free internet”
Reviews.Author: stardomee
Reviews.Content: Hotel in great location close to the centre, tourist attractions, shops, cafes and restaurants. Also 2 minutes walk from Gran Via Metro station (tickets costs 2 euros per person from or to the airport). Shuttle service to the airport available, once per hour but not free. Very friendly and polite staff. 2 lifts available, oddly shaped and of different sizes, one really small, both very busy. Hotel also close to the red district but not a threat whatsoever. Breakfast on the expensive within the hotel, around 14 euros per person. A lot cheaper in any nearby cafe. Free luggage storage, very much appreciated. Our room was large and always very clean and tidy. Free fast wi-fi internet in the room (so bring your laptop or netbook and ask for a free Access Code from the reception). Good size bathroom. Air-con works perfectly well. Pillows thinner than usual. It is a good idea to bring a travel kettle as no kettle is provided. We spent 9 nights in our room. Overall, very pleased 4.5 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pk123456
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for about 8 nights at Hotel Arosa in Aug 2009; we were very happy with the rooms; the location; and the buffet breakfast; and the service from hotel staff! Hotel is centrally located, within walking distance from many tourist attractions, and close to two different Metro stops. We felt quite safe even late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: sun010
Reviews.Content: This hotel doesn't stand out - either as exceptionally good - or bad. It has a great location close to Gran Via and was quiet (had a room facing the back yard). We found BW Arosa a good base for exploring Madrid during a girls weekend. Our room was a little tired (carpet, curtains, painting) and there was absolutely no luxury at all. The in room safe was a mystery but eventually we managed to figure it out. Breakfast met all our needs and the bar was a good place to rest the feet or have a drink before dinner. The elevators at this hotel are really tiny - if someone had even the smallest suitcase (often the case at hotels ...) we had to wait or take turns going up or down, a bit irritating of course.

Reviews.Title: “2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKHolidayAdvisor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in mid August 2009. The room and hotel furniture and décor are very old and in desperate need for renovation. The room furniture is dented and scratched. The carpet is worn, very dusty and soiled. Basically, this hotel is a two star hotel and categorising it as 4 star is a fraud. Starting with the entrance hall, the two armchairs are so worn that you could actually see the threads (see pictures). Even the toilet seat is dented and scratched. The hotel’s bad points well outweigh its good points such as good location, an ok breakfast and closeness to the metro station. Security is another problem, the hotel reception is on 2nd floor and the ground floor entrance hall is open all the time and they only put someone there when they expect new customers arriving (mostly between 12 and 5 pm). The lifts are programmed to make a stop at the reception floor but they are hidden from the reception desk, besides reception staff don’t act as security guards. So, practically anyone can easily arrive at your room’s door. Another strange thing is the room safe which you will need a credit card to open and close, which means you will always have to keep a credit card outside the safe. Will I stay here again. The answer is a big NO.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad, but ..."”
Reviews.Author: IamFromNewYork
Reviews.Content: This was one of 2 hotels we stayed at inmadird on our madrid-Seville-Barcelona-Madrid journey. I chose this hotel for teh last 2 nights of our trip to expereince a different location (althouhg it turned out that this eally was not too far from our firsthotel, the Moderno) and because it offerend free breakfast and shutttle service to the airport (for a fee). The room was mdoern-looking with its hard-wood floors, although the bed cover was showing signs of wear & tear. The bathroom floor wasn't very clean upon arrival. The provissions for toiletries was the scantiest of all 4 hotels we stayed at in Spain -- ust sopa & shampoo, whereas the other 3-start hotels provided tissue, shower caps, combs, shoe polisher, bathrobes, slippers, Voices & noise from the hallways, the adjoining rooms and from above floors could be heard from our room. The free breakfast was very basic fare, but surpisingly offered miso soup. The hotel''s entrance is a flight of steps from the street so you'd have to carry your luggare up the steps, then take the very tiny elevators up to the 2nd floor to check in. Location is convenient to shops, restaurants and most tourist spots. However, there are many other hotels in the same convenient location. I was actually more pleased overall with our first hotel even if the room size there was much smaller than the Arosa's. Without the comparison, the Best Western Arosa by itlself is just OK . It was an excellent value for money at the time we bboked it.

Reviews.Title: “great location for sleepless nights”
Reviews.Author: matsmithy
Reviews.Content: Nice decent accommodation pretty close to Gran Via (noise, especially on weekends) and Chueca (gay mecca). Each room has a different design. Some of them are great, some below the standard. Majority of rooms are quite small but OK for short stay. Breakfast adequate. Two narrow and small lifts are really disadventegous if you travel with big luggage.

Reviews.Title: “If you want basic 2 star”
Reviews.Author: kentkitten
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my partner for 3 nights. Hotel is more like a 2 star. Breakfast is served 7am-10am, went down to breakfast twice at 7am sharp and bacon was COLD, no scambled egg until 7.20am on both mornings. Better eating brekkie outside. Management on reception tends to be rather negative, no please, thank you, or enjoy your stay. Good position, even though roadworks on Gran Via outside noisy. Only thing good was in leaving to return home.

Reviews.Title: “nothing fancy, but good location”
Reviews.Author: D.C.Lola
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in June with a friend on a short holiday. Check in was smooth, and although not overly friendly, they were pleasant enough. Although I speak Spanish, I heard the staff (at least the day staff) speaking in fluent English and French. There was a belhop available to take our luggage from the taxi to the front desk, but none was available to take it up to the room... and getting an average sized female and her luggage in the elevator is a challenge!! The elevators really are as small as some people describe!! Our room on the 5th floor was a decent sized room, with 2 twin beds, a small tv, a writing desk and closet. The bathroom was a bit dated, but clean and in working order. The room did have a free safe (although it requires a credit card to get in and out of it) which I liked. It also had a mini fridge, although we didn't look inside. Because the hotel is located on a side street just off the Gran Via, our room looked out on the the side street, and you rarely heard any of the street or traffic noise. On one afternoon when I went down to the bar to grab a soda for my friend, who was sick, the bartender put together a very nice snack tray and was very helpful and friendly. The location is right off the Gran Via, and very close to Peurta del Sol as well as Plaza Mayor. You can easily walk to shopping, great food and several different areas. We walked to Huertas & Plaza Santa Ana, Plaza Mayor, all along Puerta del Sol, Chuecas, etc. A little bit of a longer walk will get you to Puerta de Alcala and the Retiro Park. Taxis are stopped on the same block as the hotel. Do note that if you return back to the hotel late at night, the doors will be locked and you will have to be buzzed in- not a problem really, but something to note. The side street itself is a bit deserted on weekends, but I didn't have any problems, and although cautious, I was comfortable walking on the street by myself or with my friend. Some of the other side streets, as well as along Gran Via near the hotel, have quite a bit of prositution- more than I've seen in recent years in Madrid. But they don't really bother anyone. However clean and well situated, don't go expecting something particularly fancy or special. I would probably pay a bit more next time and stay at the other BW property, the Atlantico, which is just around the corner on Gran Via.

Reviews.Title: “location & shopping!!”
Reviews.Author: krenmartz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just off of Gan Via. There are a lot of shopping stores right on the street such as Pimkie, Stratevarius, Blanco, H&M, Top Shop to say the least. It's a great place for single young girl travellers who likes to go shopping. The hotel is walking distance to all the major tourist sites. A block away from the metro Gran Via, which makes it really easy to get to and from the airport for ~2 euros. The hotel does offer a shuttle service for 12euros. Honestly, it's really easy to take the metro and save euros that way. The room and bathroom are spacious and very clean. the rooms are nice updated and decorated. The staff are helpful and friendly. There is free WIFI. Overall, a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: frederickjohn
Reviews.Content: Great location, although I woukd be careful about straying down the side streets at night.  Place was very clean and staff helpful.  We appreciated the provision of tea/coffee making facilities on request also airport shuttle.  Good value for money, pack ear plugs if you are a light sleeper but otherwise very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stratt0n
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel primarily on location and it delivered on this as the hotel was very centrally located and near a metro station. The only downside of the location was that the surrounding area was slightly seedy at night although this did not cause us a problem. The room and service at the hotel was fine but nothing spectacular. Breakfast was rather overpriced which counteracted the reasonable price to some extent. I would definitely consider staying here again were I to visit Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - In the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: LJAMES25
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a block from subway system Gran Via and is on the main strip. The room we had faced the street. We thought it was be loud at night but it wasn't too bad - bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. The room was clean and a good size for Europe standards. We got single beds which were comfortable. Not the nicer washroom (colour wise) but we may not have been given the best room. The room was clean. The hotel staff were a bit stuck up but any questions we had they did answer. The evelators are SMALL and weird shaped lol. We walked most times. The location is the selling point. It is very safe and you can walk to ALL sites and shops (Gran Via is the main street in Madrid). There is a grocery store at Cortes de Ingles in Puerta de Sol which is a 3 min walk from the hotel. Internet is free if you bring a computer otherwise you have to go to the internet cafe a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeniseDownUnder
Reviews.Content: Location was good. Lifts are very small. Rooms were a good size. Staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great location - forget the rest...”
Reviews.Author: LondonPandora
Reviews.Content: The positive fact - its a great location on the Gran Via - so like staying on Oxford or Picadilly circus. Convenient for metro. Well ... it was booked via airmiles who assured me it was a luxury 4 star hotel. Well 4 star HOStel would be nearer the truth. When was the last time anyone stayed in a 4 star hotel without. room service or Doorman - we had to carry baggage up the stairs - that took 2 trips in the lift. Check in- two single rooms. we arrived to the rooms still carrying our luggage! two bags each. I think boxroom would be a better description. One room had been modernised with wooden floors and a clean modern bathroom. The other was old, grubby and had a locked mini-bar and tiny TV (think 1980s motel) Unfortunately the modern room has some plumbing problems so we asked to change both rooms. After about 10 mins grumbling among the staff we were told they had no other single rooms, that that we were on a voucher (obviously a bad thing ) at this point I remonstrated in Spanish that the plumbing problem was not our fault and demanded they fix problem - we were shown another tiny single room - 1980s style. Thats was the choice take it or leave it. It was late so we wanted room service as we had a flight first thing so needed an early night. Sorry no room service (remember its 4 star!!) ok, lets book breakfast then, sorry no room service or ability to book breakfast you will have to come down stairs in morning - Ok but we need to leave at 7.00 - sorry breakfast doesn't start until 7.30..... (keep remembering its a 4 star!!) all in all I won't be recommending this to anyone other than a backpacker who just needs a room to crash at nightime. However as it was charging around 150E a night I don't know who they think is going to pay this much for so little services just to get a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ilan A
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel with my 14 years old sun for 5 nights. The hotel is perfectly located, in walking distance from all the attractions and the room was clean and nice. Here are few tips: 1. Those who care for the room design might have a problem as the room is looking somehow as a hospital room (at least the two beds room we had). 2. Don't eat breakfast in the hotel, 14 Euros per person is much too expensive. 3. The hotel doorman recommended Zahara Cafe next door for breakfast, don't go there. it is very expensive and they also try to cheat us giving us change from 20 Euros when we paid 50 Euros. 4. Toledo is a lovely place 70 KM out of Madrid, the best way to go there is by train but you should by tickets at least one day in advance at Atocha station. 5. The lifts at the hotel are small but surprisingly we didn't experience any problem of load on the two lifts. 5. If you have a laptop you can use free of charge the Internet.

Reviews.Title: “average and old, don't overpay”
Reviews.Author: ejh470
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an old building, so it has that odd smell to it. don't go here expecting anything fancy. It is barely up to a 3-star standard in the US. beds are not extremely comfortable. I was on 7th floor and Gran Via noise was still significant.... so bring earplugs. Service was friendly and attentive, but all i did was take some wine one evening and also check-in/check-out - so not much interaction. Yes, the triangular elevator is interesting.. The location is excellent for tourism. Even getting from airport to hotel via the Metro is easy (albiet having to switch trains twice) since the Gran Via stop is just 2 blocks from hotel. Also, it does have free Wi-Fi that works reasonably well. I would stay here again only if the price is still around 60euro per night.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average-in no hurry to go back”
Reviews.Author: gillhan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located for exploring central Madrid and beyond since it is very close to Gran Via metro station. The hotel very clean and well-maintained. The lifts are extremely small and odd-shaped, making it difficult to fit both people and luggage inside. This is particularly problematic if you are on an upper level, where using the stairs isn't an attractive option. We visited during a quiet time but I'd imagine this would be a bigger problem during peak holiday periods. Also, the room was uncomfortably warm (in February!) due to the heating system being left on constantly and the air conditioning switched off. This meant that we had to (try to) sleep with the window open but remained uncomfortable through the night. It would have been good to be able to control this or at least have been advised of the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: suzaoi
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for Shopping and nightlife.The bedrooms are basic but clean not as noisey as expected.Generelly we found the staff to be friendly and helpful. Strangest lift i have ever been in.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Rachub
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nights. The location of this Hotel is excellent, not far from anywhere. 5 mins walk from Plaza del Sol and 1 min walk from Gran Via. A bit noisy, could hear traffic and room next door, but room size was good. Didn't take breakfast, 14euro each, you could get a coffee and croissant in the bar/cafe over the road for 3euro for 2 people! Nowhere is far in Madrid, you could get to the Prado from the hotel in 20 mins walk, to the Palace in 10 mins, the best way to see the City... walk it.

Reviews.Title: “perfect value for money”
Reviews.Author: nataliamaridaki
Reviews.Content: I was in Madrid in September 2007 for a convention. I think I could never find such a good price for such a centrally located hotel. In Best Western hotels the best thing is that you can get an very good price for early booking, only on their official website. The rooms were spacious and clean. Just one small defect. At checkout they thought by mistake that I had not payed in advance for my stay and they asked me to pay.Very quickly everything was resolved, since I also had the confirmation with me.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, not a bad price”
Reviews.Author: loopygal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, just off of the Gran Via, and the rate was very reasonable, for about $80/night. The rooms are clean but basic, and upon request there is a shuttle directly from the airport for a nominal fee. The staff was helpful, the wifi was free. The one thing I didn´t like was that breakfast wasn´t included in the room rate, and was very expensive at 11 euros, as was the room service itself. Nevertheless I´d probaably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: JNW
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location, right on the Gran Via. Mass transit stations are nearby, but much of the city is within easy walking distance. The hotel itself is in good shape and the rooms are of decent size, for European standards. The staff, although helpful, spoke very little English.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, but not great experience”
Reviews.Author: Caryn1047
Reviews.Content: Great location. Near shopping, restaurants, subway. Walking distance to many key locations. Clean but just not great rooms. Could feel springs in the bed. Staff not very warm. Not one smile to greet us during our 4 days there, though when asked they were helpful in answering questions. Breakfast buffet was mediocre. Couldn't even get a cup of coffee in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel for a 3 star budget”
Reviews.Author: liverbirdcrj
Reviews.Content: For a business trip to the Spanish capital, this hotel was located in a good part of town to explore local bars and get a flavour of the city before flying back out again. My room was £98, and if I was paying I would not be thrilled, as the place needed an update. However it was functional for a business trip, reasonable sized room (not spacious but not a box room either) and breakfast was ok. My colleagues complained of noise from other guests in their rooms but mine was ok. The lifts were amusing (providing you didn't mind using the stairs). Not very quick, and one of them could literally hold a normal sized person and one suitcase (or 4 size 8 models). It was the weirdest shape lift I have ever been in and not good for people with claustrophobia! I would go back on a business trip, but only if i got a really good rate would i go back as a independant traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Arosa, Really the BEST”
Reviews.Author: PaulaLisboa_portugal
Reviews.Content: Best Western Arosa, is really a good Hotel to stay. Well located, near to all the good atractions, Metro Sations and Buses just in front of the Hotel. Restaurants, Stores and sites to see. If you travel alone and specially for single women, this is a good Hotel to stay. The room rate included breakfast which consisted on several things, real orange juice, toasts, scrambled eggs, bacon, fruits, cereals, coffee, yogurt, diferent types of marmelade, bread. The room and bathroom were both modern and spotlessly clean, except for the carpet on the floor (take slippers with you to walk on it!!!). There were plenty of pamphlets on what to do in Madrid at the reception. I landed at Barajas terminal 2, and found the Metro after a few minutes walk. It's really easy to use and costs only 2 euros per person to get to Gran Vía (instead of 40€ by taxi) where the hotel is located. (Barajas to Nuevos Ministerios, to Alonso Martínez, to Gran Vía. If you have really heavy luggage you can go to Callao where there is a lift (ascensor) or just take a taxi at Nuevos Ministerios to Gran Via, at about 7 € it is worth the price. Although this hotel is located just off the Gran Vía, I couldn't complain about any noise. I had a room at the 4th floor and the window isolation was good except through the walls. But that is other clients falt!!! that weren't civilized. All the staff very helpfull. Beware of a large number of prostitutes and pickpockets around the Gran Via. However, you should feel safe, as there are always a police officer in sight. Overall, the location and price made it good value but I Think that Arosa should be a 3 star hotel and not 4 star as advertised.

Reviews.Title: “good location, very very nosy”
Reviews.Author: artmax
Reviews.Content: Very good location, close to the grand via metro station and lot of stores close to it. Very very nosy hotel, the walls are paper thin and you can hear everything througt it even snoring and talking. If there is a loud person in the next room you better go get ear tampons in the pharmacy in front of the hotel, like in my case.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EmsmumDublin
Reviews.Content: Just back from the Hotel Arosa in Madrid.We chose this hotel for its location. It has a fantastic location right on the Grand Via with plenty of shops right on the doorstep. It was clean apart from the carpet on the stairs which was filthy. Our room rate included free minibar and we were lucky to have a large balcony with tables and chairs as most of the rooms only seemed to have a tiny terrace. Our room rate included breakfast which was of a poor standard. It consisted of unpeeled fruit, bread, cereal, coffee, yogurt and miso soup/rice. The hotel has a restaurant which is a sushi restaurent. There did not appear to be any room service. Overall, the location and price made it good value but In my opinion this should be a 3 star hotel and not 4 star as advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, quiet room”
Reviews.Author: feandken
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised by this hotel. We paid £60 for 2 nights in a double room. We had an internal room, which meant big windows with no view and no balcony. However, considering what we paid this place was great. The room and bathroom were both modern and spotlessly clean, the location is fantastic, and there were plenty of pamphlets on what to do in Madrid in the reception. We did not opt for the breakfast (a little steep at 13euro each). Only minor complaint would be that the lifts are ridiculously small.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: mariuskavli
Reviews.Content: Went to Madrid with my girlfriend late August 2008, and stayed at the Best Western Arosa hotel. We landed at Barajas terminal 1, and found the Metro after a few minutes walk. It's really easy to use and cost only 2 euros per person to get to Gran Vía where the hotel is located. (Barajas to Nuevos Ministerios, to Alonso Martínez, to Gran Vía. If you have really heavy luggage you can go to Callao where there is a lift (ascensor)) As we walked out of the Gran Vía station, the hotel was on the second street to the left, about 100 metres away. We were welcomed by the doormen at the hotel who should take care of your luggage as the elevator barely has room for a couple. We went to the 1st floor, where the reception was. Check in went smoothly, and we got a room at the 6th floor. The hotel room was excellent, with nice decor, dark floors and our own tiny balcony. Both the room and bathroom were very clean and we even had our own bathtub. Luckily, the room was airconditioned, as the temperatures in the city rose to about 35 degrees celcius during the day. Although this hotel is located just off the Gran Vía, we couldn't complain about any noise. We had double doors, and the sound isolation was very good except through the walls. If you want to get something from the minibar, you need to pick up the key at the reception. You also get free wifi internet, just pick up the login-information at the reception as well. There was also a safe in the closet, which was operated with your own credit card and there was a desk and a small TV in the room, with about twenty channels. The area around the hotel had shops, restaurants, bars. Beware of a large number of prostitutes and pickpockets around the Gran Via. However, you should feel safe, as there are always a police officer in sight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Michelle&Hol
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with 2 friends in August of this year. We booked through Hotelclub.net which was the cheapest price I found at just under £60 per night for a double room with breakfast. Madrid was very hot with temperatures getting into the 100's!!!! Our room did have good air conditioning though. Our room was as the other reviews say, not on the huge side but with a modern interia, and very nice bathroom. Lots of freebie toiletries that went down a treat!!! The lifts were very small, and oddly shaped!!! From the hotel, you can easily walk to places around the city. Watch out where you stop for a drink and tapas as the prices vary from very cheap to very, very expensive. Take a trip to the Real Madrid Football Stadium, we really enjoyed it. One thing I wouldn't suggest, is taking the metro from the airport. It's very confusing and you need to change a couple of times. Get a cab!!!!! I would deffo stay in this hotel again, as the location is brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “The Arosa was a GREAT find!”
Reviews.Author: arwashing
Reviews.Content: The Arosa was in the best location, right off Grand Via! It made shopping and walking to popular tourist sites (Grand Via, Sol, Palace, etc.) very convenient. The hotel was very clean and modern. The breakfast buffet was quite nice and was a step above continental, although I wish the food options would have changed just a bit from day to day. The room was small, but quite normal as most standard rooms in Europe are smaller than in the USA; however it was clean with modern furnishings and an updated bathroom. The elevators were quite small and very oddly shaped. One elevator was in the shape of a triangle which made traveling with a lot of luggage very difficult. I am not sure how they accommodate people with disabilities and I recommend the stairs for people that are claustrophobic. With that being said, the major drawback in my opinion was the heating/air conditioning system. At the time we visited Madrid, it was colder than usual (12-17C) and the heating system had been shut off to run the air. Therefore, we froze for the 3 nights we were there. It didn't warm up in Madrid until the 4th day and we were checking out. But oddly enough, the common areas (hall, lobby, etc) were all warmer than our room. My suggestion is to make sure if you stay at the Arosa, you travel during periods where if you need air, you can have air, but if you need heat, you can get heat - we didn't have that luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Spherical
Reviews.Content: This is in no way a "style" or "boutique" hotel but it has everything you need for a stress-free trip to Madrid. The rooms are very clean and have the essential AC and double glazing (Madrid is loud!). The bathrooms are large and our room had a balcony - good if your other half is a smoker! Staff efficient and helpful - we needed to print something which they couldn't do but pointed us in the right direction. There is free Wi-Fi in the rooms you just need to ask for the 3-day "voucher" which you can re-new throughout your stay. The location means you don't need to take the Metro for any of the major sights but if you do it is very clean, cool and cheap (1 Euro). If you are used to over-priced, over-heated, glum hotels in central London you'll like the value of this one (we paid 40 Euros a night - try that in central London!). There have been a few comments on "night workers" near the hotel but the streets were always so busy day and night it shouldn't be a concern. We always felt safe plus the tourist centre of Madrid is heavily policed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrsGTenerife
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a great location for exploring Madrid, great for couples and small groups on a weekend city break. The hotel is very clean and reasonably priced, the staff helpfull. We explored the city by foot and found our way around very easy from the hotel location just a few steps off Grand Via. Hotel quiet considering it's proximity to the main street. Would definitely stay there again and would have no doubts recommending to friends. The La Latina area is a great visit some excellent places to eat. However we didn't have a very good experience at the Museo del Jamon on the Grand Via near plaza espana, staff incredibly rude, but the restaurant next door fabulous. We went to see the Beauty and the beast which was wonderful even though my spanish is't great I really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money when under 70 euros”
Reviews.Author: rosimb
Reviews.Content: Central Location, close to atractions and Gran Via Metro Station. Families be carefull, lots of "night workers" around. We payed around 60 euros per night, which was excellent. We booked about 2 months in advance through Ryanair.com and got that price, half of the normal one. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. with big bathroom and minibar. Our room was very quiet so good night sleep. Last day they kept our suitcases whilst we looked around Madrid before catching our train at night. The elevators are really funny! TINY, see picture.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lovespain
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Best Western Arosa for 4 nights. It was a clean hotel and the staff was very nice. The location was wonderful, as we were right on Gran Via. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could have done better!”
Reviews.Author: LozM
Reviews.Content: A good location but not as described on their web site. We were a party of 6 (3 double rooms). Advertised as tea and coffee in rooms but that seemed to be a real problem. Advertised as having an iron and ironing board - non - existent! Lifts - 2 - one takes three, one takes 6 (well really 4). Better to walk up or down but we had one wheelchair and one other with walking difficulties! Internet / wifi - can't send / receive mail unless you use webmail based prog. Rooms - tired. Language - good English at reception but other staff no chance so problem with room service. Overall - not a 4*, would struggle to make 2* in some places. Would I go back? - No.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: granny40
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a lovely holiday in Madrid. We spent 3 nights at the Best Western Arosa Hotel which is situated just off Gran Via in the centre of Madrid. It's an ideal location for visiting all the attractions that Madrid has to offer, minutes from the Metro, Buses etc. We found the staff very friendly and helpful and English speaking reception staff were a bonus. The buffet breakfast which was included in our three night stay could not be faulted as it catered for all tastes. We would certainly use this hotel again should we return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “You GEt what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: RicoLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. The front desk was mad I had brought my own computer. Gave me a room over looking a roof, which was full of pigeons and crap. They tried to charge me for breakfast I never had. When they finally gave me the access numbers to the internet it was for 3 nights only and I was staying 4 nights. Had to get an addtional night. By going to the lobby and practically begging for it. Hotel is located within everything, but Madrid is not that large of a city to start with. Located next to the tattoo parlors and hookers. Rooms are extremely small and dated. Don't believe the photos! Bed was as hard as a rock, if not harder. Very noisey!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Gringo-in-Spain
Reviews.Content: Our first time staying in Madrid, my wife and I selected this hotel for it's location. We stayed 3 nights and used 2 rooms since we had 4 in our party. We had rooms on the third floor, which only has 4 rooms total, so it has the potential to be very quiet. The rooms were nicely decorated, ie. laminate wood floor (Pergo?), high ceilings, huge headboards and a modern bath (the lack of a shower curtain takes some getting used to. Instead they have a "half" glass door). The room had a thermostat, but did not seem to change the temperature much. (Outside temp was 65 in day, and 50's at night). The walls in the rooms seemed thin and noise from your neighbors can easily be heard (and vice-versa). Cable TV was very limited in channel selection for English speaking stations. The hotel is essentially on Gran Via, but fronts to a side street. It is conveniently located and an easy walk to shopping, restaurants, Puerto del Sol and Plaza Mayor. The hotel is also fairly close to the Metro lines. There is a breakfast buffet in the morning, however, it is expensive (13 Euros per person). In our case it was not included in our room rate and was an added expense. The staff at the desk spoke broken English, so we were fortunate that I speak Spanish. I would not hesitate to stay here again, however, next time we'll eat breakfast at the local coffee shop and save our Euros. Generally speaking we enjoyed our vacation in Spain. My suggestion to others - be prepared to spend "muchos Euros" while in Spain since nothing is cheap there.

Reviews.Title: “Noise”
Reviews.Author: broadsmanLondon
Reviews.Content: Conveniently central and despite the following comments on noises was an adequate, comfortable short stay hotel. Reception staff efficient and requests for extra linen and a coffee maker were speedily responded to.. Two lifts, one tiny and claustrophobic. Breakfast very good, catering for international guests eg chopsticks available.
