Room small but adequate and clean - but,oh dear, it needed soundproofing, one could at times hear neighbours' voices ( the actual words, not just a background sound), and the neighbours shower sounded so loud we could have been in the same room. And "toilet noises" were clearly heard. The remedy was to have the TV on even though we would not have had it on normally. Although in a side street traffic noise from the nearby main road was audible in our room during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Central Location”
Reviews.Author: hekili98
Reviews.Content: The Arosa is located a half block from Grand Via, a major thoroughfare and shopping street. It's convenient to two subway stations (Grand Via and Callao) and walking distance to Plaza Major and the Chueca barrio. There are many restaurants in the neighborhood, including a McDs and Starb. In fact, one of the benefits of staying in this area is that many of Madrid's sites are a walk or subway ride away. The hotel seems to have been recently refurbished. My double room came with a queen bed, was larger sized with tall ceilings and was nicely furnished. The bathroom was well equipped with glasstop counter, raised bowl and tub/shower combination with Grohe fixtures. Breakfast was not included in my room price but it was a reasonable E13 for a good selection of hot and cold dishes with fresh coffee. Wireless internet is complimentary. However, the location is both a benefit and a problem for the hotel. While it is convenient, it is noisy. Although the room windows seem to be well-insulated, it cannot prevent the loud Madrid traffic noise from disturbing your sleep. Madrid is a very noisy city so if you're a light sleeper, ask for one of the few interior rooms that are situated further from Grand Via or stay elsewhere (but ask about street noise). Also, the between-room insulation was not be adequate because I could hear muffled discussions from neighboring rooms. Even an interior room may not help a light sleeper at Arosa. What about the evening trade on Grand Via? Yes, there are female street walkers between the Grand Via and Callao stations. Generally, they don't bother you and I never felt unsafe. But I would not recommend this area if you have children. For others, the location, recently-updated rooms, and free wi-fi may be the right hotel combination for a visit to lively Madrid...

Reviews.Title: “Great location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: rockstar3434
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very central and is easy walking distance to major sites and a Metro stop is one block away. However due to its central location, there is heavy pedestrian and car traffic all around, thus making it a bit annoying when arriving and departing. The staff is helpful. The morning breakfast buffet actually has food, rather than only bread and cheese. My single room was small, a little worn out, but clean overall. The walls in the rooms seem to be thin as I could hear a lot of noise from neighboring rooms (i.e. tvs, door slams, and loud voices). I don't know if they're supposed to be soundproofed or not, but if you get noisy neighbors, you'll hear them. Regardless, this place is inexpensive and centrally located so I'd stay here again and just deal with it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the middle of December, and upon check-in we asked for and were given a non-smoking room. It was neat and clean, and importantly in the winter, warm. The bathroom was modern and had very good water pressure and hot water. The only minor drawback was that there were only three English language tv channels. As for the hotel in general, it is in a central area within steps of shopping, restaurants, and the subway system, which was easy to use and a short ride from the airport (though 2 simple train line transfers are necessary for the trip).

Reviews.Title: “Not up to other reviews”
Reviews.Author: Bytel
Reviews.Content: Nice reception and friendly staff, breakfast buffet uninspiring, but worst of all the Rooms, we were in a twin with a street view 5th floor. There was evidence of damp, the bathroom was tiny and worst of all electrical plug point of which only one usable was coming out of the wall, very unsafe. I would not stay here again unless it was totally refurbished and no it does not deserve 4 stars at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: anywhereonce
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, right on Gran Via, so ideally placed to visit all the main areas of the city. The rooms are perfectly acceptable, and the bar and restaurant (we had breakfast included) very pleasant. The triangular lift is big enough for 4 and needs to be experienced. Overall a very nice hotel in a great location, when we go back to Madrid this is where we will stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: Voyage55
Reviews.Content: Despite its billing, this is no "four star." The walls are paper thin - we could hear talking and the hair dryer very clearly in the adjacent rooms. Our first room was next to the elevators and very loud in the morning as people came and went in the hallway. An electrical panel in the room made a terrible ringing sound at night. The person at the desk that night said: "Yes, it happens sometimes." The hotel agreed to move us into another room the next day, but we got no apology from the sarcastic and rude staff for the inconvenience. Moreover, when we checked in, the price was, to our shock, higher than what we had reserved at - hotel staff tried to explain that two of the nights were weekend nights and are always more expensive. We complained by email to Best Western, but so far they've issued no apology. There are so many other hotels in Madrid - don't waste your energy or sacrifice your comfort on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: EPD
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short city break at the Arosa. It was an excellent experience all round and I can recommend this hotel without reservation. We were allocated a room on the 8th floor which had an outside view of a side street and Gran Via. (Room 812) It had been refurbished in Japanese style and was smart, well equipped, clean and the bathroom was very impressive being all black, cream and chrome and very well equipped. Bed linen was very clean, firm bed was comfortable. Towels were white and fluffy. The only slight thing I could say was that the bed was in Japanese style and was very low and wouldn't be suitable for anyone elderly or with arthritic joints as it was quite a job getting up and standing up from it first thing in the morning! :-) We had a 'sort of' balcony, a little wrought iron grid across but nowhere to step out on. Check in staff were excellent as were the door staff. The lifts were efficient - one is extremely small and a bit claustrophobic! You can always wait for the larger one if it's a problem...... Rooms were very quiet and ours was air conditioned which meant we could close the French doors at night. We didn't use the mini bar - and were disappointed there were no tea/coffee making facilities. We didn't eat in the hotel as we thought 14 Euros pp was very expensive for breakfast. Over the road at Pans & co they do a breakfast deal for just under 2 Euros which was excellent. We ate at night in a restaurant called Ribs which was just around the block behind the hotel. Great steaks! The great thing about this hotel is the location - it is smack bang in the middle of everything and the excellent hop-on-hop-off bus stops right opposite (by Pans & co) We spent a day on that - swapping lines and the blue line goes up to the Bernabeu. The stadium tour at the Bernabeu is one of the best - possibly THE best - I have ever done (and I've done San Siro, Nou Camp, Man U, Maracana and many others) I booked the bus tour online and it was all very easy. It really is the best way to see Madrid & get bearings - and the buses are VERY busy all day long. (If you are on the top deck in October - which is really the only place to be - it is quite windy, take a wrap) We endorse the comments made by other reviewers about the area beyond Macdonalds up the Gran Via - *very* dodgy with a high police presence and a lot of beggars & working girls. No-one was aggressive though. When we arrived I had booked online for Aerocity and was extremely annoyed to be told to 'wait 5 mins' at their desk and then this kept being repeated.... After 30 mins I started to become angry and after 50 I told them to forget it and got a taxi (40 Euros, not cheap) The hotel reception were extremely helpful about it and rang Aerocity and they apologised profusely and assured us they would be there for the return journey. They were in fact 10 mins early and were fine going back. Knowing Madrid better now and knowing how close the Gran Via metro stop is to Hotel Arosa I would most definitely use that next time. I was extremely impressed with Madrid - the buildings are fabulous and the whole ambience of the city is good. It is also extremely CLEAN. We just didn't have time to do everything eg go in the Prado and so with East Midlands airport on our doorstep and cheap Ryanair flights we shall be returning to do the museums and galleries and also to go further afield to visit L'Escorial, Segovia, Toledo and maybe even Seville. Will we stay at the Arosa again? Resounding YES, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Shelbyweeg
Reviews.Content: I just returned from an overnight in Madrid and stayed at the Hotel Arosa because of the location-the location was very good, but the hotel and the staff were horrible. The twin beds were very uncomfortable (you could feel the springs), the walls were paper thin and the room next to us had about 5 children staying there and were noisey all night long, bouncing balls off the walls, running and screaming through the halls. When we called down to the front desk (which we had to call 3 times with no results), they were useless, said they would look into it and never did, we then asked for a different room , and again said they would look into it ,so we had to call another time and were told the hotel was booked and basically said that "in Spain, it is ok to make as much noise as you want until midnight." Complaining to the management the next day did no good. So if you are ok with no sleep, then this is the place for you. I would not recommend this hotel at all, the staff were not helpful, the beds uncomfortable, the noise unbearable. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: george_197
Reviews.Content: It was very bad, staff is unfriendly, cleaners still money from possessions and breakfast is extremely expensive and not so good. Rooms are not cleaned properly and very small. Also it is impossible to sleep, too much noise. They do not help with taxi booking. Only good thing about this hotel is location. I was very disappointed and would not recommend booking this hotel and making the same mistake as I have made.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible disappointment”
Reviews.Author: teppy83
Reviews.Content: The Arosa is situated in the very heart of Madrid, on the Gran Via. It is perfectly located for exploring the city on foot, and for getting around by metro. This is about the only positive thing I can recall from our stay there however! Visiting the hotel in 2004, the reality fell so short of our expectations that we claimed a partial refund from our travel agent, given the pictures we were shown when booking. The room furnishings were very passe - though admittedly a brown/orange bathroom may have been fashionable once! - and the fittings totally worn out. One plug socket was even held together with staples! A complete contrast then, to the stylish and airy rooms we had seen on the site. My best guess would be that renovations taking place had not yet reached our floor. These were not our only complaints about the hotel though, as the check-in staff could not possibly have been more rude, the lifts were too small to be of any practical use, the ground floor access was laughable and the single glazing meant that street noise kept us up all through the night! The room fittings at least have probably changed since our stay, but do think twice before booking here, especially given the choice of other accommodation in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, we'll be going back!”
Reviews.Author: SamsCalling
Reviews.Content: We paid 281Euros in total for 3 nights in the BW Arosa, through the BW website's 'early web booking' package a few months ago. We chose the hotel because of the excellent location, right on Gran Via (the hotel entrance is a few steps up a side street, but the front of the hotel looks onto Gran Via), the reasonable price & the (mainly) good reviews on here. The hotel didn't disappoint. I had requested a room with a view of Gran Via on one of the higher floors, and we got room 711 which was on the 7th floor, with a superb view of Gran Via. We had a balcony, very small, but we could fit 2 chairs on it so we sat there a few mornings & had some breakfast. The hotel charges 13 Euros pp for the breakfast buffet, although we chose to go to the nearby supermarket (ground floor of El Corte Ingles, 2 minutes from the hotel) & get something from there, as we were on a tight budget! We found the staff to be very friendly. The room was cleaned daily with clean towels and toiletries left. There was a minibar in the room, you get the key at check-in if you want it, and a safe which you use by swiping a credit card (it doesn't charge). I believe there was a bar serving light meals or room service, but we didn't use this. I intend to go back next year with my boyfriend & we'll definitely stay here. The location is fantastic, 2 minutes from Gran Via metro station, it's a clean hotel, great views, we had a really nice room which had been refurbished & couldn't have asked for anything more. Make sure you book in advance though - the hotel tariff displayed was a steep 168 Euros per night!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: Madridista078
Reviews.Content: At first I was a little concerned when I first got to the hotel because it was actually on a side street. We arrived with via aerocity.com, which is well worth the 20 euros(one way). As soon as we checked in they said the would upgrade us to a room with a balcony, very nice, and the staff was great. The bellboys took our luggage up to our room because the elevators are quite small. The bellboys are always at the door during the day until the evening and they are good with their English, whenever we would ask where something was, they gave us great directions. Don't go for the breakfast, it's too much. You can walk down towards Plaza del Sol and find Hotel Europa for almost nothing, and there are a few TAPAS around. However, Spaniards and other Europeans don't eat a breakfast like North Americans do. One more thing, if you are in to bullfights, then you'll want to go to the Corte Ingles and ask where to get tickets. Unlike the websites we paid 6.50 euros per person and it was great. The subway from Plaza del Sol to las Ventas is only 1 euro each way and it took 6 minutes to get theres. ONE FINAL THING, the bellboys were very heplful when it came time to weigh my luggage. Because my wife and I flew within Europe the airlines are more strict about weight limits (20kgs/person). They told me that across the little street from them there was a pharmacy, and all pharmacies have a scale. The morning of our departure the bellboy helped me carry my bags over and weighed them. Hotel Arosa is great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: D0lphin
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Arosa is a newly renovated hotel in a great location, just off the Gran Via and within walking distance of the museums and the Palacio Real. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and well-appointed. Our hotel rate included breakfast. There was a huge selection of hot and cold foods and beverages. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Great Modern Design in the Rooms, Wired (Free Access)”
Reviews.Author: LyonZ
Reviews.Content: The Arosa is a terrific hotel and an excellent value if you can find a low weekend rate. Regular price for my room was 140 EUR but I was able to book it for around 60 EUR through the hotel website. Be aware, bargains do exist! The hotel is located near the Gran Via Metro stop and right behind the Casa Libro bookstore facing the main Gran Via thoroughfare. Check-in is on the 2nd floor (3rd floor by US standards) but also on that floor is a large lounge area that is also Wi-Fi compatible. If you are a guest, you can request a 24-hour Wi-Fi access pass for free! Normally such things cost 8-12 EUR for one day, so this can help pay for the cost of the stay. The room I had was large for a single. Although there was no view (I had requested an isolated, quiet room), I had a large bathtub and shower with good water pressure, a large basin area and a large bathroom. There were wooden floors and a small nightstand near the bed. A mini-bar was also available but to use it you had to request the key from the front desk, so I opted not to use it. There was a well-lit writing desk with AC outlets nearby to plug in your laptop. The closet and drawers were also large (much too much for a single person!) and there was even a safe to put valuables in it (you need to run your credit card through it to use it). Best of all was the location: literally 50m from the metro station (which is located near a McDonald's), and if you take a walk further down the street it's located you end up right in the middle of the shopping district that leads up to Metro Sol: within five minutes you have access to all branches of the El Corte Ingles stores (supermarket section open until 10 pm -- good for buying supplies for the next day or for dinner) as well as movie theaters (the glorious Callao theater included) within walking distance. Be aware that just on the other side of the McDonald's is a less savory area that you should not walk down alone if possible: even though there is a police presence there it can be intimidating for a first-time traveler. Some previous reviewers have called this hotel an "oasis"; I wholeheartedly agree and would strongly recommend this hotel, for the location of the hotel and the quality of the room (excellent bed and also air conditioning inside the room).

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Sam_Mart
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, lots of bars and restaurants and shops. However the reason to stay there is the great lcoation right next to the Metro. We never ate or had a drink here as there is so much to do in the area. Booked this hotel for a special occasion and I contacted the hotel to allocate a good room, which they did, we had our own balcony overlooking Gran Via, modernly decorated, with a lovley bathoom, was very impressed. The main street of Gran Via is quite expensive, but it you go off the beaten track you will find the cheaper locally used restaruants and cafes. The Metro is the only way to travel, buy a 10 stop ticket, we bought one of these between the two of us and it lasted for our whole stay of 3 nights, well worth it for 6 Euros with the 1 Euro supplement from the Airport. The open top bus is well worth it and you can swap and change from the red bus to the blue bus, although we thought the red bus tour was the best. The Palace and the Mayor Plaza were both lovely places to visit, the atmosphere while visiting here was so relaxing and while walking and sitting around you seem to go off into your own little bubble! The main park on the tourist map with the boating lake is also a fantastic place to loose yourselves in, with a picnic you can spend the whoe day in there and you must hire a rowing boat an incrediable 4 Euros per boat for 45 minutes, an absolute must, so romantic if your with a loved one. The Bernebeau Football Stadium where Real Madrid play can be visited for 10 Euros each, you pass this on the bus tour. Shopping is also really good, but not so sure about the spanish fashion!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: CrisMilan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Arosa for 3 nights in June 2007. I booked through Hotels.com, and asked for an upper floor room with balcony, and I got it ! The room was nice, renovated and clean, if missing some decoration (i.e. a painting/print on the walls). The bathroom was renovated too; it feels a little small, but it's really fine. The safe works by using your credit card - there is no charge though. If you want to use the mini-bar, you have to ask for the key at the reception. We were overall very satisfied with Hotel Arosa, which is in an excellent location, in the middle of the town. There are several Metro stops around, but we just walked everywhere. So yes, there is the "smallest elevator ever", but 2 people of regular size + kid fit in fine. There is also a second, bigger elevator. We actually had a bell-man bring our luggage straight to the room anyway. In conclusion, we think that hotel Arosa is an excellent hotel for the price and, we if we're back to Madrid, we may stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, OK Staff”
Reviews.Author: int-reviewer
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this hotel. It is located in the perfect location to explore the city of Madrid all while offering above par accommodations. The hotel rooms were large both European and American standards and were very well appointed. The beds were extremely comfortable and the linens were superb. The only complaint I have about this hotel was the staff, they were not at all friendly and lacking in care for their guests. Otherwise, this s a great choice while in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, that's about it, awful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Northernbelle
Reviews.Content: I'm astounded by some of the reviews on this site, we had a dreadful experience in this hotel. We booked a 2 night stay June 15th-17th. We were met by miserable, unfriendly reception staff, not a good start, things could only get better. We were allocated a twin room on the 3rd floor, I have stayed in a lot of hotels abroad and this has to be the worst room I have ever been in. The walls were full of brown stains, it was filthy, it was appalling! When we asked to be moved reception were surprised that we were unhappy with the room, I wouldnt have kept a dog in it. The second room was cleaner but very tired and yes more mysterious brown stains on the wall, awful experience and to top it off we had no view, only a brick wall outside,the room had no natural light so our whole stay felt like nighttime! Breakfast was average, I'm not actually enticed by a rotten, decaying bowl of fruit. The icing on the cake was when an item of clothing was taken from the room by a maid, trying to explain to hotel staff and ask if they could contact laundry was like pulling teeth, This matter has yet to be resolved, needless to say we would never return to the Arosa, nor would we recommend to anyone else. It is close the City, yes but so are other nicer, friendlier hotels, stay clear!

Reviews.Title: “Shocked at the Great Room”
Reviews.Author: khoward
Reviews.Content: I was actually a little skeptical of making this reservation, because I had seen mixed reviews. I did request a room with one large bed, rather than two twins, and that it be in the remodeled floors. (I had read that not all rooms were remodeled.) Well, they delivered, and then some! The room was actually very modern, very clean, and had a good amount of space in the main area. The bathroom was amazing! I have not had such a modern bathroom in all my European travel. To top that off, this hotel has a bell staff, so you are never lugging your bags. And, they have elevators from the ground floor, which doesn't always happen either... The front desk staff were great, and you could stow bags if you arrive before check-in or are staying after check-out. The location is actually really close to the Puerta Del Sol, Royal Palace, and Plaza Mayor. It is also easy to get to the Metro (maybe one full block). This was a great hotel experience, though it is on the main street, so there is some road noise. I didn't notice it on the 9th floor!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: saverb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. Walking distance to a lot of attractions. The rooms are modern and clean with the beautiful bathroom. Per our request we had one big bed instead of the 2 twin beds. We also had a little balcony with the nice view of the city. The hotel has tiny funny looking triangular shape elevators but the 4 of us could fit into them. Definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location great city”
Reviews.Author: loopylou1559
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and had requested a refurbished room and we were not disappointed, we had a great view of the Palace and Madrid as a whole. The room was great, modern decor and the bathroom was a real luxury. The breakfast was good, wide selection however we got a bit of shock as we thought the breakfast was included in the price of the booking, the breakfast was quite expensive at 15 euro each day so make sure you enquire when you check in. Overall loved this hotel the location was fantastic, the city tour bus stopped directly across the road and i would recommend this hotel and i would definitely return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Via and Gran Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CurtisTalls
Reviews.Content: the Arosa, in my opinion is an excellent hotel. A prefect choice for anyone who wants a nice 4 star in Madrid. My room was huge and beautiful. I did book a deluxe room, but the standards looked nice as well. It's location is prefectly set right on the Gran Via, a stones throw from any point of interest in Madrid. The Staff were polite and helpful. I can honest think of nothing negitive to say about this hotel. Book away!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: anac0ndazx
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in very good location, Gran Via, where you are walking distance from all the great shopping in madrid and all the theaters and shows available. Like a broadway in nyc. The hotel was down a small street off Gran Via, it was a bit small but very nice, clean and modern. Unfortunatly the hotel elevator could only fit two people at a time, and the room was right there when you enter but it was a great location at a good price. Bathroom was above average, very good. The hotel booked an excursion for me to Toledo, El Escorial and Valley of the fallen, suberb trip loved it. The hotel was very close to the metro station, which is near many resturants and fast food chains.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast==ridiculously expensive!”
Reviews.Author: brumeux
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, right smack on the Grand Via. However, the breakfast was 13 euros per person per day. We were never informed that the breakfast cost money, let alone 13 euros per person. Huge signs were posted, "Please join us for our breakfast buffet" and so we thought, ok, even if it did cost money, probably not more than 5 euros a person. Boy, was I wrong. When I checked out, the bill came out to 150 euros just for breakfast! And that was only for 2 persons, 4 nights. Imagine having a family of 4 staying there for 4 nights=208 euros= $391 us dollars ALONE on breakfast! If we had known it was that ridiculous, we would've had a simple meal at a nearby cafe. Trust me, we did not get our moneys worth at the breakfast buffet! The hotel was very misleading! Beware!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great great great location”
Reviews.Author: ariday333
Reviews.Content: This hotel is smack in the middle of La Gran Via which is a very very busy street. There are great chain restaurants and tons of stores to shop just a few steps away. There was a great little restaurant/internet cafe called Sahara just around the corner from the hotel. The hotel itself is like a little hole in the wall, barely noticeable because of it's small entrance, but the rooms were impressively clean and decent in size. The bathroom was very clean which is very important to me. The service was great as well. I was traveling on a very tight budget and you definitely got a whole lot from this hotel...great location, clean room..what more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Great located, but not great”
Reviews.Author: BPro77
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in the Best Western Arosa. Of course we chose it because of the location in the inner city of Madrid. However amongst others also because of its modern look presented online. To cut a long story short: We entered a room totally decorated with lavender pattern like your grandmother would have loved to decorate it with. The bathroom seemed to be from the 70ies. So please see my photos before booking this hotel. This is what your room can look like. ;-) However it was really clean which should be of greater importance. Unfortunately the walls aren't that thick. So we really could hear every word spoken in the room next to ours. And a further disadvantage: The personnel could have been much friendlier. Arriving in the hotel we didn't get the slightest smile. I had the feeling to be considered more than an intruder than a guest. To conclude: Great located, but wouldn't recommend it to my best friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: noworries2004
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very central near all shops(although thought shopping would be better there), Book room 728 if you can beautiful balcony overlooking Grand Via street 7th floor(only very few rooms with bug balcony) perfect for a drink overlooking madrid, Room spotless and lovely, paid 188 euros for 2 nights thurs and fri. Absolutely recommend the hotel to anyone touring madrid, One elevator is tiny but otherwise everything else ok,

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't make a repeat visit”
Reviews.Author: Lucypdx
Reviews.Content: The location is good because it's right in the middle of things. The "double" bed (which was an American king size) was also good, but that's where it stopped. The room was very small and the walls VERY thin. This is definitely a place to take ear plugs if you want to sleep. Some of the staff were helpful, but others acted as if we were just annoying them by asking directions, etc. Very mixed place. We also agree with the other reviewer that the place just seemed "tired."

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Best Western”
Reviews.Author: rosey_tree
Reviews.Content: the location was great - very close to the main square. The common areas of the hotel were nice. Our big issue was the room itself. It was very small and looked worn out. It needed new carpet and a fresh coat of paint. I would recommend taking a room with twin beds instead of a double bed because those rooms are much bigger and you can just push the beds together.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice”
Reviews.Author: abettel
Reviews.Content: Well-appointed and centrally located, within walking distance of the museums, parks and shopping. We had a recently refurbished room with nice light wood, modern fixtures and a cool sound system. The breakfast buffet was good and the staff efficient and friendly. And we got a kick cramming into the tiny wedge-shaped elevator with our bags. Re: sound from the street -- Madrid is a town for night owls so if you can, nap during the day and stay out late soaking up the atmosphere in the plazas or on the Grand Via.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff...”
Reviews.Author: lilybelle264
Reviews.Content: Just there June 12 to 17 and hotel was great for the price and I could not complain. The hotel is in a great location on Calle Salud and Gran Via. The rooms are clean comfy and despite being right off the Gran Via the rooms are somewhat quiet. Double pain windows, The breakfast buffet was wonderful, the staff went out of our way to make sure our stay was more than pleasant, ok so 1 of the elevators is small 3 to 4 people could fit (tight squezze however.) but so what. I am not there for the elevators!!! Any way the location is perfect, close to Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Gran via and even The Palace. Museums you could take the bus#2 or 202 and get off at Parque del Retiro and walk the park its perfect and then go to the Museum Prado. To me this was the best experience. Be careful in Gran Via however, there is a homeless guy with 3 dogs (good well behaved dogs) that ask for money, these dogs are better taking care of than my own dog. I gave money, I felt bad for the pups not the owner. Anyway other than that, this city is the best!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveable Location!”
Reviews.Author: BillT2
Reviews.Content: This fantastic little hotel is located within very easy walking distance of all the main sites in Madrid including the Plaza de Major, Plaza del Sol, Casa Botin Restaurant, Via Major, etc. The hotel itself is old and one of its two elevators is so small two people have to enter it sideways but the interior has been totally renovated and is crystal clean! The staff is friendly, bi-lingual, and extremely helpful. The breakfast buffet in the lobby is a great way to start your Madrid exploration. Our balcony had a great view of the Gran Via (major shopping street) which was only a few steps from the hotel's front door. This hotel is a great bargain for the money and I sincerely hope to be able to return again.

Reviews.Title: “central and conveniant”
Reviews.Author: judith3
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in May 2006. The hotel is centrally situated and conveniantly positioned on the Grand Via : The Palacio Real is at one end of the street and the Parque del Retiro is at the other. We walked everywhere which was a good way of getting a real feel of the city. The hotel provides an airport courtesy bus which needs booking the day before. The cost was 9 euros per person. Taxi from airport was 22 euros. Reception staff very helpful. Ask for room at back of hotel because of street noise. Hotel is good value 4* grade just a bit noisy so if you can sleep anywhere go for it! Well organised excursion company and recommended are" julia's travel" at 68 grand via . easy walking distance from hotel; we booked trips on internet before we went but no cheaper than booking direct on arrival. "Gastronomic meals" were extra on toledo day trip but gastronomic they weren't!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: philip2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Best Western Hotel Arosa for 3 nights at the end of April. I booked the hotel based on trip advisor reviews. I was very pleased with the Hotel as it was centrally located and all of the major art galleries and sites were within walking distances. Loved Madrid and enjoyed staying at this Hotel on the street called Grand Via as there is so much great shopping in this area. My hotel room was at the back of the building but was quiet. Grand Via is a busy, lively street and the rooms facing the streets might be noisy. The room was very clean and had a nice bathroom. My only complaint was there was a bad smell in the room after I turned on the air conditioner. I should have asked to changed rooms. Instead, I spoke to the maid who sprayed the room in an attempt to freshen it up. She was very accomodating and tried to help. All in all it was not a big deal but and I lived with the bad odour for a day. I would suggest eating breakfast down the street at VIPS which is a convenient store and restaurant if you are on a budget. They have a good breakfast. I think the buffet at the hotel is overpriced but I am sure it is convenient. All in all this a good place to stay while visiting Madrid. Enjoy this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Alaskan94
Reviews.Content: Good location, easy to explore the whole city from hotel. Located very near metro stop. On main street but enterance is off main street and quite. Helpful staff. Commen areas on upper floors are a little worn but clean. Rooms are in very good shape. Get instructions on working the heating/cooling system in the room. We do reccomend and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: pottystu
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Madrid, 27 to 30th March, and stayed at the Arosa. The hotel is in a great location for getting around. The staff were very helpful and polite. Yes you do hear a bit of noise from the streets below, but this is Madrid and there does not appear to be a quiet time. The hotel was clean and okay but we obviously stayed on the floor where the rooms have not yet been refurbished. Overall I would only rate this hotel as a 3 star. Would I use it again - I think yes. Good location and staff, just needs a little tlc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money! Very central to all amenities!”
Reviews.Author: KissesCheshire
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fabulous trip to Madrid. Booked by my partner as a Christmas treat I was slightly dubious when I read some of these reviews but they were all unfounded! It is literally a few steps from the Gran Via where you have access to the Metro, MadridVision (the open top tourist bus)and local transport. But mostly unnecessary as most things are well within walking distance - Sol, Plaze Mayor etc Our room was fabulous! We were in 529, obviously newly refurbished with the biggest bed seen outside USA! Easily able to avoid partners snores.......... Really modern, chrome and white bathroom with powerful shower and decent sized towels. Only down point here, two large mirrors were both in bathroom and obviously steamed up after a shower! Note to Best Western - move one of them to bedroom - ladies don't like putting make up on in the reflection on a picture! We didn't experience noise from outside and it was good being able to look down on the hustle and bustle of busy Madrid. Breakfast was OK (served 7 - 11) but we had it included in our rate. Lounge very plush and elegant and drinks served here were very reasonably priced. Yes, reception is on 2nd floor and lifts were tiny but does that really matter....... Only serious problem we had was the advertised Courtesy bus to and from airport. Upon arrival at airport we asked at Tourist Info where it stopped and were duly advised where and that it was 'on the hour'. This was a ltttle long for us but it was a beautiful day so we decided to wait. After about 25 mins a Best Western bus arrived but the driver told wouldn't take us (he was picking up people for another BW hotel) but told us that the Arosa bus went from Terminal 4! We were in Terminal 1! We then got the public bus (No. 200 and 1 Euro fare) to the centre of Madrid and a taxi from there (9 Euro). Coming back we booked the shuttle the day before and paid our 2 x 9 Euro fee. This bus then dropped us at Terminal 4! This might not mean much when reading this here but it's about a 20 minute bus ride between these 2 terminals! A free airport bus transports you around but I would certainly consider another option if travelling in and out of Terminal 1! Thinking about it now, it may have been worth 'tipping' the bus driver from the other Best Western hotel to take us - it was only over the road from the Arosa. Think it was called the Atlantic! As regards eating out in Madrid, its mostly tapas type places so you need to know what you're doing! We eat at the Botin one night (reportedly the oldest restaurant in Spain if not the world!)and it was excellent. Bit of a touristy place (Hemingway eat here) but worth the effort and experience - approx. 100 Euros with wine for 2. Booking is advised. All in all it's a wonderful city! We took a 2 day pass (19 Euros each) for MadridVision to cover the 3 tours (historical, modern and monumental) and this was excellent value for money. First day we used it for the actual tours and next day we used it to get from place to place. Having said that, it's a fairly compact city and walking is also a good way to get around.We loved the Palace and Opera House area and it was lovely sitting outside here on a warm March night watching the world go by. Likewise the Plaza Mayor - sitting over a few beers in sunshine can't be beaten. PS The building the Arosa is in on Gran Via is mentioned on one of the tours as being note worthy!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value and quality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel twice (in Winter 2004 and Summer 2005) and on both occasions found it to be very good quality and exceptional value. Yes, it does have street noise (this is right in the city centre) and reception on the 2nd floor, but this isn't a problem for me. Lifts are small, but this is common for boutique hotels in Europe. The only caviat I have is that rooms on some floors are renovated, but not on all floors. The difference is huge! Just ask them to book you into a renovated room, and you will find it to be not only modern and clean, but also quite stylish.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: BayArea007
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for its location and price. The location is right near the Gran Via, can't be beat for centrality, but not the most relaxing part of town. The room was small but clean, quiet and comfortable. I would defnitely request a room that is not on the interior, mine overlooked a dingy courtyard and got little to no natural light (this was on the 5th floor). The breakfast was included in my rate and is wonderful with pastries, cereal, eggs, and lots of fresh fruit. The staff speaks English and is helpful when asked. The bar is nice to relax in at the end of the day. There are two elevators, one of which is too small to accomodate a person and a large bag and the other is fine. Both are slow. Free internet in the rooms if you bring your laptop and ethernet cable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: marcia_marcia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and were very pleased with every aspect of this hotel. Since it's a Best Western, I'd booked for a fabulous rate through the corporate web site. The location couldn't be better, it's steps from the Gran Via, a block to Plaza Carmen, and very close to Plaza Sol and Plaza Mayor. There are three different metro stops, different lines, within a few blocks of here so that you can plan your trip and not have a metro line change. I actually can't believe there is a review that's posted with complaints about the location of this hotel. We found the hotel elevators fun and great for meeting other travelers. We really enjoyed our clean, attractive room which had a small balcony overlooking the Gran Via. The staff was very helpful and accomodating. We would definitely stay here again and I suggest you check the main Best Western site for a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel late august and after reading such good reviews decided to book 3 nights with Expedia. I know from experience pictures can be misleading, but I did not expect the hotel to be that bad. My hotel room was nothing like the images on Expedia (or any other websites), where the décor was very, very out dated, and bathroom was small, also very dated. The air conditioning was very noisy (which I had to switch off because I couldn’t sleep), a bit ironic as I did request a quite room (away from the road side noise). There was also a horrible smell, as if the sheet had not been changed. All in all I was very disappointed with the so-called 4star standard. But I’m giving a rating of 2, one for the location (excellent location, walking distance from the main sites) and one the city of Madrid, beautiful city. Oh and the staff was not to helpful either.

Reviews.Title: “NOT What I Expected.”
Reviews.Author: melgares
Reviews.Content: I am not usually one to complain but I believed the other reviews about this hotel and I had great expectations. I had a very bad experience with this hotel. I do not mind spending a little extra so I chose this hotel hoping I would get my money's worth. Well, It was one disappointment after another and it all started with the desk clerk who was rude and not very welcoming. The location of the hotel is not ideal. The entrance and registration desk on different floors is really wierd not to mention the triangle shaped elevator big enough for two people...sideways. The room was a big disappointment. I felt like I was in a cheap motel off the interstate. The room was 10x15 and everything was very old. The breakfast was not included like proclaimed in my reservation and the internet was so slow I could not even open Yahoo. Steer clear of this one there are much better places to stay. My prepaid reservation was for three nights, I left after one night.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Stu010
Reviews.Content: Great thing about the hotel was location, being a few metres off Gran Via and a 2 minute walk to puerto del sol. The room we were allocated had loads of space, great view over the city, powerful shower and was cleaned everyday. Bar was spacious and very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a good location next to Gran Via and Puerto DEl Sol The rooms are spacious and clean with air conditioning. All staff are freindly and helpful and the hotel offers a shuttle bus to the airport for 9 Euros Would recomend this hotel to people looking for a value for money centeral hotel

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably good value for a capital city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great city location, never quite cracked the hot water to make tea at breakfast without local assistance! Breakfast was expensive unless part of a package which we had. Bar quiet but reasonably priced, room comfortable and adequate. Most amazing small lifts in Europe, designer was clearly smoking the wrong stuff!!! One lift is triangular and tiny! Would'nt have a problem staying again, very efficient pick up for the airport. Overall good value.

Reviews.Title: “We thought this was great”
Reviews.Author: louropa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Best Western Hotel Arosa this past month. We had an excellent stay. Our room was clean, modern and spacious. The bed was very comfortable too. It's in an excellent location, very close to the Plaza del Sol and other tourist spots. The only sore spot was the breakfast. If you opted for it, the breakfast was 13 Euros each... which... to us, was a little expensive for coffee, toast, ham and cheese. Overall, we had a great stay and we would definately stay there again.
